title: Looking for someone to text
text:
I work in a financial institution in the loop and thought everything in my life was all well and good. 
Then I got a news from my manager that the company was downsizing and they might lay off a bunch of us.
It was like getting electrocuted. I couldn't feel anything for a while. It felt like I'm in a dream or something. 
I was scared and I panicked. I didn't know what to do. 
Later that night when I went to bed I couldn't stop thinking about it.
And I realized that I got too scared that the scare vanished of fear. 
Then I started thinking what I was doing with my life 
where are am I going?
What is the purpose of my life?

Then the thought went on...
why should I have a purpose in my life?
Why should I prove that I'm successful or I'm making any money to someone?
Why should I care about the society?
I felt that I should get out from this rat race which not taking me anywhere.
I woke up next morning and it all felt like the movie fight club 
Things that I own have ended up owning me. 
I live in a 1 bedroom apartment alone. 
Why do I need a 1 bedroom?
Why do I need that leather recliner?
I don't eat on the table then why the fuck do I have a dining table and chairs?
So I decided to let them all go. 
So I go back to work and realized they are not firing me. 
But I have decided to keep that fire in me to give everything I don't need or require. 
I've decided to move to a smaller apartment not because I can't afford my current one it's just because I don't need it. 
I was talking to my friends about this and they call me crazy for leaving the bigger place and moving to a smaller one similarly they find it stupid to move out of a place when it is not a necessity whereas me, on the other hand, realize that the biggest advantage of living in an apartment is the mobility it provides. So I wanted to utilize it to the fullest. 

If u would like to talk to someone about stuff like this, Platonic relationship. No picture exchange required. I was looking for more like a pen pal. I would like to see whether there is someone who actually is into talking. I'm a movie buff who loves to eat burgers and bike around. 

If you think we could make an interesting conversation shoot me a message. I don't know l whom I'm looking for but I know for sure that I'm not looking for any trump supporters. :(

title: Perfect Marriage - Perfect Life
text:
Life is good. You love your spouse, have beautiful children, have a nice home and cars. Your friends tell you how you have it made and how lucky you are. "Yes" is what you say each time you hear it and you here it often.

Yet here you are reading my words. You aren't aware of it but you are nodding your head slightly. You might even have a smile on your face as you read the previous sentence. You're reading the words of a man who is very much like you. Yet here I am writing and posting this.

Why are we here? Curiosity, boredom, loneliness; take your pick. Maybe we just want something in our life that is just for us. A confidant. A secret friend. Someone to reach out to that understands us and gets why we are here. Someone who knows we don't have all the answers but we seek answers to something. A friend.

It's raining.
I love the rain.
Life is perfect. :-)

2. Love of the outdoors, nothing better than being with Mother Nature and loving a ski trip, a run, a bike, a hike, a kayak, a boat, anything outside.
3. A good drink, a night by the fire with a good wine or a great beer is good.
4. A superhero outfit, you never know when you will need one.
5. A good education and a good job. This is one of the things I value in my life that is up on the top. Prob #3.
6. Enjoying the moment.
7. Random yard ornaments. Gazing balls, solar lights, bird baths, shiny things are so darn cool.
8. Random thoughts and acts of kindness, 4 out of 5 voices in my head told me to post this. 
9. A getaway car. 
10. I am not looking for a meetup. That's why I posted in strictly platonic. No pics are necessary, just a like mind. And someone that like to write.
11. Eleven is from heaven, tell me about yourself. I won't respond to a "Hello" especially after I spent the time to create this post.

title: At a loss...please advise
text:
There's this guy I like. We've been chatting in person at his work for about six months. Usually when a guy initiates a conversation and chats me up it's because he's interested in something happening. Not sure if that is the case for this guy, I'm getting some serious mixed signals. 

He's grumpy most of the time but when we talk I notice him smiling a LOT. He hasn't asked me for my number so we're limited to only interacting when I stop by his job. He's had PLENTY of opportunities to make a move beyond the job. I haven't asked for his number because I'm afraid I'm reading him wrong. I've tried convincing myself that he doesn't like me so that I can move on. 

I've always thought that when a guy is REALLY interested that I would definitely know. The complication is that I'm very outgoing and maybe he's shy? Maybe I'm delusional because I just really want him to like me. Surely he would have made a move by now right? Is he stringing me along to feed his own ego? I think it's very obvious that I like him because I tend to wear my heart on my sleeve so maybe he's just enjoying the attention and doesn't plan to do anything about it. 

Help!! What am I missing? Put me out of my misery please!!

title: searching for my needle
text:
You have a good life. Married, kids, a great job, a nice home. To someone on the outside, they'd probably be jealous. Yet to you, who's on the inside, you feel like something's missing. Some passion. Some excitement. Something. 

You keep trying to ignore the thoughts, because again, you have a good life. But you can't help but wonder if someone else is out there who feels the same way. Or at least understands where you're coming from. So you end up on CL, searching through the haystack, trying to find the needle. 

Maybe you're my needle?

title: Message In A Bottle
text:
Depending on your age, you might have the sultry tones of Sting's voice bouncing in your head. And that's aces! Also, sorry for the ear-worm.

Bug I've digressed from my own narrative before even starting. Tsk, tsk self. Here goes...

You find a bottle on the beach. (I suppose it's bad form for me to emote on your behalf, but it's just for the prologue, I promise this is the last time, but for sake of getting to the point...) You reach down and pick it up, noticing a small brown parchment inside. You fish it out, unfurl and smooth it out on the edge of a park-bench. Scrawled on the missive, in naive but passable calligraphy are the words:

"I'm trapped in a world of bankers, accountants, engineers, and haters of the Oxford comma. If you've found this, and you can endure geekery..."

title: I know you're tired of not having that perfect guy friend...
text:
Let's face it.. Since the beginning of time, there's been this weird thing about guys and gals and friendship..

Forget all that, because I've had amazing female friends in the past.. but that was in highschool. 

We'd be laughing all the time because we knew what made each other laugh, we'd always poke fun at each other, talk crap to each other and tease each other.. 

You know, the type to get separated by the teacher and moved to the far sides of the room because we'd always be talking and laughing and whispering while the teacher was trying to teach

and when we got into problems with other guys or other females, we'd have each others backs like "you woulda kicked his ass.. i know it.. good thing u didnt fight though" or "she's just hating because she wishes she can be like you".. that moral support thats far more validating than when it's coming from friends of your own gender..

However, life takes us down paths, we learn lessons and life isn't as simple as it was back in highschool.. and some of us don't go to college.. 

What I'm like: ALOT to handle for some.. But an amazing personality, great sense of humor, sarcastic, confident, tough but also a goofball, caring, considering, but also a loveable asshole

My preference: I'm open to every race.. especially girls who are a little ADD, because i'm the same way ... we're different than most and we have way more fun. If you get along with guys more than gals, maybe that'll help too.

title: 11:11 soul connection
text:
Hey, hi, hello : ) 

I'm searching for some good people to communicate with--or just one aware soul to develop a good friendship with (or whatever is meant to be). If 11:11 is a special synchronicity for you then that's a good sign. ~3*3~

I have an interest in all spiritual, metaphysical, and esoteric topics, science/quantum mechanics, transpersonal psychology, ancient wisdom, new thought, personal development, alternative health and healing, meditation, nature/outdoors, animals, games, art, music of all kinds, adventure, and SO much more. I'm also interested in web design, internet marketing and writing, which is also what I do for work. I believe in love, kindness and trying to 'be the positive change I wish to see in the world'. 

If you are someone who has good old fashioned morals and values, but is unique and open-minded, or even someone who considers themselves an 'awakened/aware Soul, lightworker, wayshower, indigo, starseed, empath, or alternative thinker or spiritual/truthseeker' (although, I don't necessarily believe in 'labels') then we will most likely get along well. : ) I consider myself a bit eccentric and have had many of my alternative interests since I was 5 years old. But I'm also just your average girl-next door and can blend in with the mainstream, if need be, lol. 

At this time in my life, I don't have many positive people to interact with on a regular basis. I've always been somewhat of a hermit who would rather have a few good and trusted people in my life rather than dozens of acquaintances or false friends. I don't resonate much with social networks like facebook anymore so I'm trying a different route to find something special.

I'm currently in the process of healing my spirit from a very long dark night of the soul. 
Part of my soul journey at this point means reaching out to find like-minded and good-hearted individuals to connect with so I can keep focused on a good path (I have BIG dreams for the future); also, to keep myself distracted from some of the negativity (and negative people) in my life because I've allowed a lot of it to hold me back and keep my stuck for quite awhile. 

I am a bit weary about posting this but Spirit guided me to take this chance, so i WILL. But I must say that if you are someone with negative intentions, expectations, or just looking for a 'good time' then there is no need to reply. I am simply looking for people with similar interests who (for now) wouldn't mind exchanging emails from time to time (or even daily text message) in hopes to develop a meaningful connection. 
Maybe you are someone who feels lost on your own path and also has big dreams in this life, but just wished they had someone to connect with each day for inspiration or even emotional support on your journey. 

It would be nice to have someone I resonate with to just share my day-to-day happenings with, who might also be looking for the same. In the future, of course it would also be nice to have a trusted friend to attend local events with (like metaphysical meetup groups, museums, nature walks, etc). But right now, I don't wish to exchange photos or phone convo with anyone because I would rather focus on soul connection (and weed out those who may have more misguided intentions, lol). 

If you resonate with any of this or if synchronicity is guiding you to connect, then feel free to do so. I may not be able to check email or respond right away but eventually I will. : ) 

Please know, I am NOT looking for a date, or any kind of 'hook up' or anything bizarre, but rather a genuine and honest connection with someone that has actually read through all of this! lol. Please NO married men or players! For those of you who might be kinda shy.. If you'd like, you could start conversation by telling me your hopes, dreams, fears or even about any interesting dreams, visions or paranormal experiences you've had past or present). 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read through all of this and I hope you have a blessed day!



"If you change the way you look at things, the things you look at change" -- Dr. Wayne Dyer

"Forgiveness is the fragrance that the violet sheds on the heel that has crushed it" -- Mark Twain

"Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend" --Albert Camus

title: Define friends
text:
Whenever my friends would ask "Why would you rather go out with her, instead of them?" I'd give them that look. That look that says "Why would they ask again, when they already know the answer?" Fortunately, they know why. I'd rather be going to concerts, road trips and building snow forts instead of doing what they always want to do. Which of course, is playing video games or watching tv. Which I could do but sometimes I'd rather be with you. 

After all, we're also friends. You'd always be into some funny stuff, like going on random trips with no plans or waking me up in the middle of the night to go out and play laser tag or something. Me being crazy as you sometimes, would be up for it. However, you would always help someone out of a jam, brave enough to get dirty to someone's aid and you know how to silence your phone and be quiet during a movie. You can care less about social media because you have good friends. People always thought you had a boyfriend, including me, but we were always good friends. Wonder whether you're still on that adventure. 

Friends like you are hard to find but here I am looking. Are you someone who would make a good friend, be up for some grand adventures, always have your friend's back and are serious about being friends in real life? What you waiting on? Email me. We could go out to lunch sometime and get into a food fight. Put your name in the subject and tell me why you'd rock as a friend.

text:
My marriage is falling apart and I think its to the point of no return. It appears to be over just like flipping a switch. I have asked you 100's of times to talk to me. 100's of times you refused saying there is nothing to talk about. Countless times I have attempted to fix whatever it is that was bothering you yet you constantly pushed me away. Each day you seemed to drift further and further away. Yet I'm right here next to you holding your hand refusing to let go. Why is it that you wont accept my help? The things you have said cannot be unsaid. The things you have done cannot be undone. Congratulations. You finally got what you wanted. You successfully pushed me away too.

I need:
Someone more grown up and mature. 
Someone that's not selfish and only thinks about themselves.
Someone that understands a caring hard working guy that strives to be the best husband that he can be. 
I'm sorry that I call you when I get off work to let you know I missed you and I'm on my way home.
I'm sorry that I call you when I get off work and ask how your day was.
I'm sorry that I call you when I get off work and ask if there is anything that you need me to pick up on my way home.
I'm sorry for hanging on when clearly you have let go.

title: Friends that travel
text:
Greetings,

What I am hoping to gain from this post is essentially a small group of ladies to travel with. The ladies I meet through this post, I will connect together in a Group Me message, we all begin to form friendships with each other, hang out locally and eventually take affordable (less than $350 per person) weekend getaways. It isn't a requirement that I be the glue that keeps everyone together, I'd rather not have that pressure on me, nor will I make each trip. 

Ok, a little about me....

40 years old AA woman with children.
I enjoy concerts, comedy shows, lounges, darts, line dancing, House music, improving myself(mental, physical and financial).
I am very outgoing and not shy at all. 
I drink socially, and never do drugs nor cigarettes.
I am not interested in drama, people asserting their way of thinking on others, passing judgement (this isn't about who is pretty or thin enough to hang with me, she eats different than me, etc), closed mindedness (unwillingness to try new things/food), and having to always check up to see if you are going to meet or go somewhere.

What type of women I am hoping to gain from this post:
Outgoing
Openminded...likes to try new things/foods
Willingness to step outside of your comfort zone
Gets along well with others
Looking to travel
Looking to do more with their time here in Chicago
Is willing to suggest/research activites/outings/vacations and supply details
Understands this group, as a whole, will only be as strong as you make it.
Dislikes Drama and will not stoop to participate in it.

There is no set limits to how much we hang out, if you are bored and need an outing, suggest it. Again, I want to form trusting friendships, so I can later go out of town more often.

Have a wonderful day.

title: friends
text:
Hello, Im looking for friends who enjoy more things than hanging out in boystown. Love to find a guy who likes to see bands at a small venue, the atmosphere at shows is much more intoxicating to me. I also like Small bars where you can actually hear each other. Nothing better then talking about various subjects over a drink or two. Would be nice to meet a guy who is well read so we can have decent conversation.

If you enjoy museums that would be a plus ,the Art Insititue is a fave prob , cause of the painting Nighthawks. Its an amazing painting, speaks about the fear and other feelings of 1940's wartime america. Enjoy walking around the city and check out different neighbourhoods , also fun just looking at the buildings, some amazing ones out there. I do enjoy checking out new photographers and once inawhile try my hand at pics, I usually like to take pics of buildings but im a novice if anything.

In the case of music I think my collection is eclectic. I can only pin down one style that is my fav but there are so many sub-genres of it, I love punk so you can see that style leads off into to so many other genres lol.

Flim is another area that I hope to meet guys who like the odd indie film or even the really dumb films like 'They Live' or 'Army of Darkness' , I do enjoy most genres. I do love the classics , film noir is to die for , check out 'the Third Man' , the 'The Killers' , Odd Man Out amazin stuff. title: Friend for Physical and Emotional Trust
text:
CL - I know how crazy this place is. When you see something like this, generally you should run in the opposite direction because "Netflix and chill" or whatever they call it these days usually means there's a crazy person on the other end. Yet, there are sane people here. So here's the deal:

I'm a very normal, working, educated, often described as handsome man with his own place, car, values, etc. The reality is that I've made a lot of (good) changes in my life and have moved on from my previous serious relationships such that - here I am, a guy who is used to having someone to love and who is waiting patiently for the right woman.

In the meantime, casual sex and all of that are *out* of the question. That is why I'm posting this - otherwise, I'd just be dating and doing what everyone else is doing. And if you're the same and are / have been in this position, you know how tough it is to be without physical and emotional intimacy that was always there before. The loneliness builds character, but it's also a very difficult thing to live with month after month.

The thought is that if you are a nice, sane, working woman with values who also needs a trustworthy male friend for the same or similar reasons that we can simply share that gift of trust and strictly platonic interaction with one another. That's it. No hidden language or agendas. Friendship from the beginning and no possibility of anything more.

If that works for you, send a message and we can exchange some info. If it doesn't, good luck!

P.S. - I'm very comfortable with my heterosexuality. Men, God bless ya, but I'm just not interested. Peace.

- It takes years to build up trust, and only seconds to destroy it. 
- People can get by on charm for about fifteen minutes. but after that, they'd better know something. 
- Money does not equate to happiness but it really doesn'Â€Â™t hurt it either 
- That I can keep going long after I think I can't. 
- That regardless of how hot and steamy a relationship is at first, the passion fades and there had better be something else to take its place. 
- That credentials on your wall do not make you a good human being. 
- The most beautiful Woman are not usually the best lovers 
- A bad kisser is not worth kissing at all 
- You can be in a good marriage and still be lonely 
- A trusted friend is a necessity of life 
- I have many friends who feel the same way, and I'm not alone. 
- Flirting is fun, and keeps the fire burning inside. 
- These observations may get longer.. but they never change!

Would you like to make your visit to Chicago memorable and delightful? My name is Bill. I was born and bred in one of the greatest cities in the world...Chicago, Illinois and I love showing off my hometown. Is there anything special that you'd like to see or do while you're here? Make a list of the things that you would enjoy seeing and doing or allow me to suggest places of interest for you. I will chauffeur you around town and/or the surrounding suburbs and show you everything and anything my city has to offer. I am a very good driver. I have a fully insured Hyundai Santa Fe SUV and a clean driving record. title: Joyce, I Miss You
text:
Joyce, it's been two years that you've been gone. I can honestly say that I miss you
every day. There are those that feel that the craigslist personals is a hellhole, and I guess I
probably agree, but I met you through CL and it was one of the best things that could have
happened to me. 

I posted an ad seeking a mature woman and through a crazy circumstance you responded. 
For some reason we hit it off immediately. Your mind was open enough to understand my
situation and you shared a bit of your unfortunate situation. We'd been writing for two
weeks when you surprised me by asking when we might meet. We agreed on a time and place
and I was nervous, wondering if I could go through with it. I did, and couldn't have been happier. I
think we probably intended to spend an hour or two making polite conversation. It turned into
six hours and we delved deeply into our lives. I think we were both surprised by the information
we shared but felt relieved that we had each other to talk to. I know we could have stayed and
talked longer but we both needed to get home. I walked you to your car, we shared a few more 
words, then I asked if I may kiss you. It was nice and we kissed again, then we parted. As I
drove away I wanted to go back and see if you were still there. You later told me you sat in
the parking lot a while longer hoping I'd return.

We built a relationship based on friendship. Yes, we were lightly intimate but agreed not to take
things too far. You know...not go all the way, and we were fine with that. Being together seemed
to suit us just fine. Talking, doing small things together, writing at night. All told, we had about
nine months together, then life got in the way. We kept in touch by e-mail and the occasional
phone call. About a week or so after our last call it dawned on me that you hadn't written. For
the fun of it, I googled you name. What I saw felt like a hard punch to the stomach. I saw your
obituary. I think I wanted to cry but couldn't. I'd been taken by surprise. I knew you weren't
entirely healthy but certainly never expected your sudden passing.

Sometimes I'll go for a walk alone and it seems like the sun is shining directly on me. I like to
think that's you smiling at me. I'll step outside in the dark on occasion looking to the southwest
at a particularly bright star. I feel it's you once again and I have to tell you how I feel. 

I never said "I love you". Because we were both married I didn't feel it would be fair to you,
though we sort of joked about it. Now I say it each night. I love you and miss you terribly.

title: Baby it's cold outside.
text:
Athletics, desire and cleaning, what's the connection?
Personally, If I'm to have my furniture and carpeting cleaned, I want it done by someone strong enough to tackle the job at hand. More important, by someone who enjoys the work they're doing. I've been cleaning carpets and upholstery for twenty years, I have the experience.

That's what you get with me: A strong athlete and guy who loves his work. I'm a powerful communicator, you can relate your needs to me and I'll understand and comply. Tell me anything, I've heard it all.

When I arrive, I'll survey the work to be performed, make an assessment of what needs to be done and how I plan to do it. I'll communicate the plan to you and then get to work.
I find it a challenge to remove as many spots and stains as possible, giving your items a clean and sparkling appearance.

Pet problems? Dog urine, not so tricky. Steam cleaning along with the application of an enzymatic neutralizer can usually do the trick. Cat urine is far more challenging due to its tenacious nature. Most times with feline urine saturation, the odor is there to stay no matter how many times you clean, deodorize or attempt to neutralize it. This is from experience.

I'll treat your carpeting, area rugs and furniture with kid gloves (metaphorically) and treat them as if they were my own.

All work performed is guaranteed and I will return for recurring stains and bleed backs. 

About me: I've had this small, one man operation for twenty years, as a supplement to my career as a freelance writer. I'm active in athletics and train for two triathlons every year. I'm an avid swimmer, biker, runner and believe health and fitness should be a way of life.

For further information, please do not hesitate to respond to my ad: The picture is me.

text:
I do or have done many kinds of dancing, my latest target is Salsa rueda, which is a number of couples in a circle, with one person "calling" or telling everybody what to do. This is similar to square dancing, another love of mine. Some of the calls are done just with your partner, some cause a mix with men or women moving on around the circle to a new partner.

I would like to join a class at a studio Candace dance (7 PM Tuesdays), near Elston and Lawrence, which seems to have more beginner men than women, plus if you are interested, I would like to have a friend to go and practice rueda figures as well as regular salsa with some weeks, or go to places where others are doing Salsa Rueda. Or other social dancing.

To do this, you should have some experience with Salsa, or minimal experience at Salsa Rueda. Being a good follow can lesson how much actual salsa experience you need.

Beyond Rueda, I do other kinds of dancing, some of which a partner to go with would be helpful, and if you do swing dancing, that is my best rhythm (east coast swing not west coast). Some country and ballroom. Also International folk dance and English/Scottish Country dance, Western Square dancing, Round dancing and American Contra dancing. Would do Irish sets if that is your preference.

What's in it for you? Well, ask me, we can negotiate. I'll pick you up/take you home if not too far out of the way (if you are coming a long ways from the opposite direction, that would be too ungreen). If we dive right into the rueda class I'll pay the first class or two, sometimes when we go elsewhere to dance, if we dance well together. We'll both learn salsa and salsa rueda, other dancing if you are interested. There is a bachata class immediately afterwards we could both take. The classes are $14 per class, less with a 5 class pass. Or, you pay your own way to dancing and i'll take you to dinner (meaning ethnic such as Chinese, Indian, African, etc) or movies (probably on other nights).

I have gone through some stressful changes and need to lose more weight (and clean my house), so this platonic for now, hopefully that is acceptable. Anyway, doing rueda you'd only be dancing with me a small fraction of the time.... I am 67 years young. I live in the NW suburbs (Des Plaines), but go pretty far to dance. Probably north of Roosevelt absolutely, and North of Belmont preferably, plus I will go to Willowbrook ballroom.

title: Looking for Friends
text:
GWM, looking for a new friend or two who would be interested in meeting for dinner, coffee, or a beer; attending concerts, festivals, museums, and other cultural experiences; taking short road trips to explore the world around us (well, whatever subset of the world can be explored from Chicago on a tank of gas or less); or just hanging out.

I work in a professional occupation and have a technology background. When not working I am involved in a few technical hobbies and volunteer work in my community, and (surprise!) I read, listen to music, and consume various other media. I'm fascinated by offbeat roadside attractions and the history and development of factories, roads, bridges, railroads, and airports. I tend to connect best with people who spend their leisure time on hobbies, crafts, music, art, or some other creative activities. I don't follow sports, celebrities, award shows, or social-media memes, and I don't watch much TV.

I like food but I'm not a "foodie". Fine dining is fine, but so is a good diner. I prefer good food and friendly service over vibe and ambiance, steak over sizzle, independents over chains, French toast over quiche, Gene & Jude's over Five Guys, and dog food over Pizza Hut.

Infrequent drinker. Non-smoker.

I hope to meet people who are smart, funny, and adventurous (though I am not).

Strictly platonic. I am not looking for dates, "dates", or hook-ups. Which means I'm not particular about your age, sex, or looks. And I'm not too concerned about your relationship status, as long as you have some free time to get together and do things, and you're in control of your own social calendar.

If interested, please drop me a line and let me know something about yourself, including your location and what you do for fun.

Thanks.

title: ... In My Dreams ...
text:
I meet you in my dreams at night
and in daylight reverie
I see you in a hundred people
Yet your face eludes me

I see you passing on the street
shopping, dinning, on the town
I wonder where you come from
Where you go, who you know

At night I lay beside one
Whose touch is too cold to feel
The passion that is needed
To simply help me breathe

I know you sleep the same as me
Sleeping half awake
Longing for the arms near you
To reach out and in you take

But they never do
Not as you need them to
You never thought it would be lonely
When you're not alone

You know you could never leave
Yet need to feel alive
To feel connected once again
In this disconnected world

I feel you near
Pull my pillow close
And feel you there beside me
Sometimes for the better
Sometimes for the worse

Longing to feel your breath
Longing to feel your sigh
Longing to smile and laugh
And gaze into your eyes

Do you see someone in your dreams
That stops to ease the pain
Brings a fluttered beat to heart
And helps you feel again

Do you ever wonder when the strangers pass
If they feel the same
Where they come from
Where they go

And if one day before you die

One won't pass you by

title: Does anyone care anymore
text:
Is it me or do people care less about others and themselves then they did say 20 years ago?

Everybody talks about doing the right thing, being honest and forthright and having morals and values but do we really live in a society that has morals and values anymore....

I'm dead serious about this and I'm curious to know what other people's experience is or how they see it. Because maybe it's just in how I'm doing it and maybe my perception is off.

I think we would sooner get angry at somebody and feel okay with that then we would trying to turn the other cheek or being kind to somebody that maybe isn't necessarily kind to us.

See I used to think that if you did the right thing, the right things would follow but I don't know that I really think thats true anymore.

It seems more often than not that the people who manipulate, lie, con, they're the ones that actually get ahead. Whether it's in a relationship, at a job, whatever. So what's the point of doing the right thing or being a person with morals and values when it really holds no water at the end of the day.

I guess I'm just very discouraged by life and what a waste it's been in many areas and I would love someone to tell me that it's really still a good place because I don't think it is anymore. 

If you can convince me of that I would surely appreciate it because I know then I'd at least be in a better mood

title: The calmness of the river, the beauty of the moon...
text:
So my post may not be completely platonic. But I choose to post it here, because the reason is simple - the hope that there maybe a lot more "real" women reading this section. So here goes my story:

You will perhaps read this out loud, doing an incredulous double-take. You could've written every word of my post - perhaps because you are living my exact same mirrored life. Its funny to think someone else in cyberland wears my exact tarnished armor? My life with many highs: the success of my profession, the accomplishments and so many things to look forward to, and the lows: the emptiness, the utter lack of romance, friendship and passion! Yup, inner angst, sleepless nights and volumes of unanswered questions. 

Second guessing and lots of introspection is the new normal. Like you, no one would believe I live such an imperfect life. From the outside, and from everyone that knows me - I'm perfect and the model husband and family man. The man, every friend wants to be, the role model of all my young(er) acquaintances.

To show you just the tip of the iceberg: My wife of many years is someone I sleep next to as we are complete strangers. Sigh.

How about a cup of coffee and conversation sometime? Or a chat on instant messenger about this craziness? Figure it out? I suspect we would instantly understand each other's drama without using words -- because we share the same story and find ourselves at same intersection & crossroads.

Please find inner peace and many answers to those pesky questions my friend...

If you would like a chat, perhaps finding comfort or a laugh about this, let me know? Or a chat, i have both gtalk and yahoo messengers.

title: Married, looking for friends
text:
I'm a 33 year old Asian woman looking for friends. I know it's a weird place to look for friends, but I figured I would take a shot. I'm looking for male or female friends, preferably married or in a long-term relationship and with kids. I'm not the kind of mom that could walk up and introduce myself to other parents at a park or a play place.

I miss making new friends. I haven't made any new friends since college which was ages ago. I consider myself to be a friendly, fun person. I'm artistic and love going out to eat, movies, museums, etc. Every once in a while, my husband and I go out to a bar or go dancing. I love being with people, although I am very shy!

I figure it's a long shot, but I'm hoping there's someone out there. Reach out to me if you're interested.

Thanks for reading.

title: Confidence, Charisma and Class
text:
...So this is one of the days that I happen to find myself exploring the streets of the CL world. Going through the various posts, I figured why not put one of my own on here. Who knows, I may come across that special connection that I seek...

So how should I begin? Mmm...perhaps I can give you a few pointers towards myself and perhaps it will charm you to such an extent that you won't be able to resist yourself from replying ;). So here goes....

*A picture: I understand we are visual creatures; and yes I will be more than happy to share a few with you. However, due to the nature of the medium we are meeting I will wait for your reply before sending you a couple. In the meantime here's a description: I'm tall (5'11") and athletic (not a gym rat but I take care of myself) with dark hair and eyes (though I have a bit of salt and pepper showing now). I've been complimented on my smile many times and I think my eyes and smile are my best features.
*Friendliness/cordiality: I like to make people laugh. Granted a specific sense of humor isn't necessarily appealing to everyone, but you won't fault me for trying
*Ability to spell and write with grammatical correctness: I think I am doing well on this count? Yes? No?....Maybe?....Oh and by the way, I can be a bit of a smart-ass myself ..:p
*Height/weight proportionality: I very well am a healthy individual. I don't obsess over anything - so I will be the first to tell you that I don't spend hours in the gym, nor do I count calories my the minute, but at the same time I don't "let go of myself". I'm tall (5'11") and have an athletic built.
*Life experiences: Yes there were many of those that have instilled in me the qualities of empathy, insight, street smarts and compassion. I very seldom "give my judgment" and I'm definitely not the social media jury that a lot of people today have become. Friends say that I am an overachiever, but I have never let my success and accomplishments go to my head. I believe we are all here for a role, and I want to play mine to the best of my abilities.
*A few miscellaneous facts: I am a well educated and a highly successful individual and have a fulfilling life. Yet I yearn to get back the feeling of the butterflies, friendship and affection (perhaps slowly at first). I want to feel my heart skip a beat when I get a text from you or the smile on my face when I login to my email in the morning and have a note waiting from you. I am definitely not writing to you because I want to jump in the sack with you right away. I am one of those who enjoy the journey, and enjoy being in the present. 
*My type: I'm attracted to compassionate women who don't take life too seriously and have a sense of humor. My weakness - a woman with great hair and awesome curves ;-). 
*The catch: I'm married; in an unfulfilled bottomless abyss....but I don't write to you for a hook up. I seek a connection of substance.

So now that you know a bit about me, and if you want to keep smiling and have some awesome fun along the way, while experiencing a fulfilling and cracking friendship....you know where the reply button is ;-)

title: Mom looking For Other Mom Friends
text:
35 year old wife and mother to a 5 year old boy. I am a stay at home mom and I also work very part time from home. My husband and I do own one car at this time and he goes to work during the day so going anywhere would require me to get a ride with someone or walk. If you prefer to give me a ride to places I can help by paying for gas and some of the things we do. 

I am looking a female that does not live too far away. I would also like to find one that had kids around my son age and my age, but I am open to any female that wants true friends. My son goes to school Monday - Friday . Here we have a kids swimming pool, we have sidewalk chalk to play with, a park around the corner, a indoor play area at the rec center, many biking and walking trails. We also have books, toys, and and TV to watch, but I would prefer the kids to play instead of watching TV. 

I like to take my dog for a walk, travel, go to museums, going out to eat, hanging out at the house, drink wine, walk when weather is nice, and going to plays. I am not really fat, but I am a little heavy and would like to do more walking and excerise activities. 

In my home we do have 2 cats and a dog so you must be okay with pets. My cats are barely noticeable, but my dog loves to be around people. She just sleeps most of the time because she is older. 

I am not looking for a sexual relationship . I am only looking for friends to hang out with. If you are looking to hook up or do drugs even 420 I am not looking to do that.

title: Message In A Bottle
text:
Depending on your age, you might have the sultry tones of Sting's voice bouncing in your head. And that's aces! Also, sorry for the ear-worm.

Bug I've digressed from my own narrative before even starting. Tsk, tsk self. Here goes...

You find a bottle on the beach. (I suppose it's bad form for me to emote on your behalf, but it's just for the prologue, I promise this is the last time, but for sake of getting to the point...) You reach down and pick it up, noticing a small brown parchment inside. You fish it out, unfurl and smooth it out on the edge of a park-bench. Scrawled on the missive, in naive but passable calligraphy are the words:

"I'm trapped in a world of bankers, accountants, engineers, and haters of the Oxford comma. If you've found this, and you can endure geekery..."

title: Chicago Tour Guide Available...Make Memories...Have an Adventure!
text:
Would you like to make your visit to Chicago memorable and delightful? My name is Bill. I was born and bred in one of the greatest cities in the world...Chicago, Illinois and I love showing off my hometown. Is there anything special that you'd like to see or do while you're here? Make a list of the things that you would enjoy seeing and doing or allow me to suggest places of interest for you. I will chauffeur you around town and/or the surrounding suburbs and show you everything and anything my city has to offer. I am a very good driver. I have a fully insured Hyundai Santa Fe SUV and a clean driving record. I am familiar with all of the basic tourist attractions and I have extensive knowledge about restaurants (we have plenty of great eateries of almost every ethnicity imaginable), bars/taverns, shopping areas, lesser known hidden gems and much more. 

My fees are reasonable and negotiable. I am sane, safe, dependable, humorous and always a gentleman. Stellar references from several out of town visitors are available upon request. 

Enjoy your stay in Chicago! Airport pick up/drop off service is available and if you are traveling alone I can also be a breakfast, lunch or dinner companion. Thank you for considering my services.

title: Fellow Nerd/Geek Wanted
text:
Looking for someone to go to meetups with and do online classes through MOOCS (Massive Open Online Courses) in UX/UX. I work for a wireless provider but in my spare time I'm starting to delve deeper into the UX/UI space. So I've bookmarked some free online courses on UX/UI, Agile Principles and similar areas through EDx, Coursea and Open 2 Study.

What I'm looking for is someone whose interested in taking some of these courses with me and attending meetups (through meetup.com or other sources) and just geeking out and learning and growing our skills. You don't necessarily have to be interested in UX/UI but some sort of tech related field would be nice. Eventually I do want to do a project such as working with a small business or community organization to make a mockup of their website. 

Until March 27th my schedule is free only on Wednesday and Thursday as I work Friday through Tuesday from 11-8pm. But I can do Google Hangout sessions or Skype periodically on these days. On March 27th my work schedule will be 1-10pm Tuesday through Friday and 12-9 on Saturday with Sunday and Monday off. 

A little about me:
-I like gadgets and technology especially devices.
-I frequently change my devices. For example at the start of the year I had a MacBook Air, an iPhone 6s Plus, Galaxy S6 Edge and a Sony Smartwatch 3. And now currently I'm rocking a Surface Pro 3, a Nexus 6P and still have my S6 Edge, a Nexus 7 and a Pebble Time Smartwatch.
-I'm always reading Flipboard or some other news app for the latest trends, apps and gadgets.
-I hate coding but love being around coders (ironic I know)
-I love listening to EDM, Hardstyle, DnB, Dubstep and the Liquid variations

Mmmmm, what else:
-AA
-28
-5' 5"
-Athletic
-I don't have my degree yet but you'd think I did and I'm always learning on my own anyway
-Prefer bike riding over driving (car or bike will be coming soon for me though)
.........Anything else just reach out to me. 


I've already started one course in UX on Open 2 Study but it would be really great to share the experience with someone else and see what we can learn and discover. So hopefully I'll hear from you soon. Laters

title: I know you're tired of not having that perfect guy friend...
text:
Let's face it.. Since the beginning of time, there's been this weird thing about guys and gals and friendship..

Forget all that, because I've had amazing female friends in the past.. but that was in highschool. 

We'd be laughing all the time because we knew what made each other laugh, we'd always poke fun at each other, talk crap to each other and tease each other.. 

You know, the type to get separated by the teacher and moved to the far sides of the room because we'd always be talking and laughing and whispering while the teacher was trying to teach

and when we got into problems with other guys or other females, we'd have each others backs like "you woulda kicked his ass.. i know it.. good thing u didnt fight though" or "she's just hating because she wishes she can be like you".. that moral support thats far more validating than when it's coming from friends of your own gender..

However, life takes us down paths, we learn lessons and life isn't as simple as it was back in highschool.. and some of us don't go to college.. 

What I'm like: ALOT to handle for some.. But an amazing personality, great sense of humor, sarcastic, confident, tough but also a goofball, caring, considering, but also a loveable asshole

My preference: I'm open to every race.. especially girls who are a little ADD, because i'm the same way ... we're different than most and we have way more fun. If you get along with guys more than gals, maybe that'll help too.

title: I Want More Than Platonic
text:
Before anyone jumps on me for this, I know I'm in the platonic section, but I've tried the other ones and there seems to be no real people over there so as a last resort, I'm over here. I wish there was an easy way to explain what I'm looking for, and a proper category to post in, but there isn't. I want to find a friend, a companion, a buddy to goof around with and yes...a lover. I am your basic, everyday, normal American male. I am married, (which isn't going well and why I'm here) 48 years old, and doing my best to stay in shape. I have what I consider to be a good outlook on life, all things considered. I can be serious when the situation calls for it, but a crazy knucklehead as well. I love making people laugh and enjoy being spontaneous. 

Now about you. Looks, race and age don't really matter as long as we can connect on many different levels. Be ready to talk and communicate. You don't have to be a genius, but have your own opinions on things and be confident enough to express them. Sarcasm is great and a little flirtatious is always nice. Other than that, just be yourself. We can figure the rest out as we go along.

So what do you think? Is this you? Am I someone you've been looking for? If so, let me know so we can get this adventure started. Please send me at least a few sentences about yourself and your situation so I know you're real. Thanks for reading this and have a wonderful day.

title: Nerds, Artists, Gamers, Cooks and Intelligent People!
text:
Hello!

So I am looking to find some really amazing people to hang out with more frequently outside of my current circle of friends. I am fine with both girls and guys (as long as you are not looking for something sexual or otherwise - I have been in a happy relationship for 6 years and am not looking!). I work from home as a freelance concept artist/ illustrator, so I have a more flexible schedule where I can be free afternoons, evenings and weekends when I want. I'd love to find someone who would like to just hang out at the apartment keeping each other company, playing games, watching Netflix etc. Also, my boyfriend and I host board game nights sometimes, and we'd love to find people who might be interested in that as well! (If you are allergic to cats, I have two of them... just a note)

Some things that we would ideally have in common:

Love of video games
Ditto for board games
Interest in digital art and animation (I graduated in animation and I love cartoons and animated movies!)
Reading books - they are so awesome and we should all read more
Cooking - I really enjoy cooking at home, and trying out new recipes and I'd love if I had a competent partner to help me cook sometimes together
Photography - I just got a new camera and I'd love to go out and learn it's workings with a friend
Being friendly, enjoying a great conversation about nothing or everything, visiting some new restaurants without breaking the bank, and just being an interesting person. 

Please don't smoke, I am seriously allergic. Also, if you are in the suburbs, I don't have a car and really dislike traveling 2 hours on the train, so you would have to be willing to visit me in the city. If you are friendly, kind of nerdy, or just like what you hear, feel free to message me. The response has to be more than two sentences and coherent (it's hard to get a read on someone who writes " yo, i b same." ) Put Ratatouille in the subject line, so I know you aren't a robot. 

I look forward to hearing from you!

title: Trail Riding Only

Why am I looking for a riding partner on craigslist, you may be wondering?

I love getting up early Saturday and Sunday mornings, put my bike in the back of my pick-up, and head out to a trail.
The I&M trail, Centennial, Salt Creek, Waterfall Glen, I love them all.

But it would be nice to share the experience with someone ... bike riding ... that is all.
With the warm weather approaching, I figure I better start looking now.
I'm looking for someone around my age, (plus/minus 10 years or so), with a working bike and fit enough to ride it.

I'm 48, and I'm an easy going guy that loves to discuss just about any subject.

If you're at all interested, please write back and put "Bicycle" in the subject line.

title: Lady seeks pen pal now, flat mate this summer
text:
I'll be moving back to Chicago this summer. I haven't been in a situation where I've had to look for someone to live with in a very long time, and now that I'm older (mid 30s), I'm not totally comfortable just picking an apartment and living with whoever has a room.

What I'd like to do is start "meeting" people now-- before I return. While where I live is important, the person I will be sharing that space with is of even greater importance. 

I am painfully normal. I don't smoke, drink, use drugs or even drink coffee (or cola, or black tea). I once explained what I do all day to someone and he said it sounded like "an idyllic existence." I have been described as "primitive" due to my preference for being functionally fit as opposed to wasting time in a gym trying to keep up appearances. 

My favourite places in Chicago are the Caldwell lily pool, Kings Sweets on Devon, the Cultural Center and the Music Box. I check out CPL library books and read them on my tablet, even though I haven't lived in Chicago for years. I love the CTA, and literally have dreams about it.

I love my dog. Hopefully, you will love my dog. I love to feed people. Hopefully, you love when someone else cooks for you. 

I'm non-white. I don't particularly care what you are, but I know it matters a lot to many people who use CL. I think it's a sad, sad shame, but my opinion is mine and yours is yours. I'm a woman, but this is the platonic section, so I would be happy to hear from men or women. One of my female friends killed herself and the other two moved to the south side. They have kids. The rest of my friends are men. Several of them have kids or have left the state/country. Or both. I feel comfortable with men who view me as a person first, and then belatedly remember I am also a woman years later. I don't have to worry about "putting on my face" that way. 

I don't play an instrument, but I consider a trip to see CSO a treat. I would love to live with someone who plays an instrument (not "in a band") and plays it well. A string maybe. I can't drive or sew and those are things I would love to do. I lived with the conviction that I am 5'6. Then I realised I'm not. I'm barely out of petite height. One of my friends suggested I labored under this delusion because I treat people as though I'm taller than I am. I wasn't quite sure how to take that, so I let it go. 

i love cats. I can not live with them. I hate smoking. I can not live with it. Sometimes I have to wake up early to clean. You may hear me start a loaf of bread at 5 in the morning, leave it to rise and go back to bed.

I'm not even supposed to eat bread. 


Your turn.

title: Life is beautiful so why live it alone.
text:
Hello! 
Life is beautiful to be living it alone. There are so many things one can do with a partner like go on adventures and explore new parts of the world. 

I am not a huge fan on using Craiglist for this, but when meeting people in the real world or even given online dating shot fails, then what else is there left to do? The reason it has failed is because online dating is more about looks and just hooking up then actually having a connection first. Many people are scared to talk or just want to have sex. It is a deal breaker indeed. 
Anyways, I'm looking for someone who to make a deep connection. See if we share common interests. Start by exchanging emails. Then maybe talk on the phone or text. Build some trust and then eventually meet and go on a date. I really mean a date not some hideous bar and get a drink. I don't think that is the type of environment for a first date unless you have different intentions. 

A little bit about me is that I am very picky. I have been told by everyone that I know. I just crave that connection. That conversation that attracts you to someone else. 

When you exchange word by word with someone to the point where you enjoy reading everything they have written to you. When you talk to them you just sit there and enjoy listening to them. I know all this is kinda hard to find but I have had that connection before so I know it is possible. 

I'm the type of guy that in his free time like exploring new parts of the world. I enjoy going out for runs and cooking. I'm very adventurous. I enjoy the little things in life. I can be reading a book on a Friday night or going on an adventure somewhere interesting. 

If you sound like the person that is into intellectual conversation and is ready to take the next step in your life then don't hesitate to send me an email. Tell me why it caught your attention. Also, to weep out those annoying robots who always send you an email and just want you to reply to another email. Put on the subject line your name and age so it does not go to my trash. 

By the way I am not a robot and I have read post on here that write that and then they say that to prove it , that it is sunny outside or the temperature. I will just say that I'm happy with my life right now but getting to know someone would not be a bad idea.

Hello ladies!

I will say I'm looking for long term friendships. Not looking for party animals or my "ride or die bitch" lol I prefer to use the term partner in crime. I'm pretty open to race, age I'd prefer 23 to 33. Preferably someone like me and in my neighborhood since I do have mild agoraphobia (which I've been struggling with). I've tried being friends with females who are married with kids or single with kids or simply in relationships and it really doesn't work out. I would say I'm really looking for a female friend who has time to hang out whether it's going out or staying in. Someone who can maybe be bored one day and we decide to hang out without planning it. title: Message In A Bottle

You find a bottle on the beach. (I suppose it's bad form for me to emote on your behalf, but it's just for the prologue, I promise this is the last time, but for sake of getting to the point...) You reach down and pick it up, noticing a small brown parchment inside. You fish it out, unfurl and smooth it out on the edge of a park-bench. Scrawled on the missive, in naive but passable calligraphy are the words:

title: Chicago Tour Guide Available...Make Memories...Have an Adventure!
text:
Would you like to make your visit to Chicago memorable and delightful? My name is Bill. I was born and bred in one of the greatest cities in the world...Chicago, Illinois and I love showing off my hometown. Is there anything special that you'd like to see or do while you're here? Make a list of the things that you would enjoy seeing and doing or allow me to suggest places of interest for you. I will chauffeur you around town and/or the surrounding suburbs and show you everything and anything my city has to offer. I am a very good driver. I have a fully insured Hyundai Santa Fe SUV and a clean driving record. I am familiar with all of the basic tourist attractions and I have extensive knowledge about restaurants (we have plenty of great eateries of almost every ethnicity imaginable), bars/taverns, shopping areas, lesser known hidden gems and much more. 

My fees are reasonable and negotiable. I am sane, safe, dependable, humorous and always a gentleman. Stellar references from several out of town visitors are available upon request. 

Enjoy your stay in Chicago! Airport pick up/drop off service is available and if you are traveling alone I can also be a breakfast, lunch or dinner companion. Thank you for considering my services.

What I'm looking for is someone whose interested in taking some of these courses with me and attending meetups (through meetup.com or other sources) and just geeking out and learning and growing our skills. Until March 27th my schedule is free only on Wednesday and Thursday as I work Friday through Tuesday from 11-8pm. But I can do Google Hangout sessions or Skype periodically on these days. On March 27th my work schedule will be 1-10pm Tuesday through Friday and 12-9 on Saturday with Sunday and Monday off. 

A little about me:
-I like gadgets and technology especially devices.
-I frequently change my devices. For example at the start of the year I had a MacBook Air, an iPhone 6s Plus, Galaxy S6 Edge and a Sony Smartwatch 3. And now currently I'm rocking a Surface Pro 3, a Nexus 6P and still have my S6 Edge, a Nexus 7 and a Pebble Time Smartwatch.

title: I know you're tired of not having that perfect guy friend...
text:
Let's face it.. Since the beginning of time, there's been this weird thing about guys and gals and friendship..

Forget all that, because I've had amazing female friends in the past.. but that was in highschool. 

We'd be laughing all the time because we knew what made each other laugh, we'd always poke fun at each other, talk crap to each other and tease each other.. 

You know, the type to get separated by the teacher and moved to the far sides of the room because we'd always be talking and laughing and whispering while the teacher was trying to teach

and when we got into problems with other guys or other females, we'd have each others backs like "you woulda kicked his ass.. i know it.. good thing u didnt fight though" or "she's just hating because she wishes she can be like you".. that moral support thats far more validating than when it's coming from friends of your own gender..

However, life takes us down paths, we learn lessons and life isn't as simple as it was back in highschool.. and some of us don't go to college.. 

What I'm like: ALOT to handle for some.. But an amazing personality, great sense of humor, sarcastic, confident, tough but also a goofball, caring, considering, but also a loveable asshole

My preference: I'm open to every race.. especially girls who are a little ADD, because i'm the same way ... we're different than most and we have way more fun. If you get along with guys more than gals, maybe that'll help too.

title: I Want More Than Platonic
text:
Before anyone jumps on me for this, I know I'm in the platonic section, but I've tried the other ones and there seems to be no real people over there so as a last resort, I'm over here. I wish there was an easy way to explain what I'm looking for, and a proper category to post in, but there isn't. I want to find a friend, a companion, a buddy to goof around with and yes...a lover. I am your basic, everyday, normal American male. I am married, (which isn't going well and why I'm here) 48 years old, and doing my best to stay in shape. I have what I consider to be a good outlook on life, all things considered. I can be serious when the situation calls for it, but a crazy knucklehead as well. I love making people laugh and enjoy being spontaneous. 

Now about you. Looks, race and age don't really matter as long as we can connect on many different levels. Be ready to talk and communicate. You don't have to be a genius, but have your own opinions on things and be confident enough to express them. Sarcasm is great and a little flirtatious is always nice. Other than that, just be yourself. We can figure the rest out as we go along.

So what do you think? Is this you? Am I someone you've been looking for? If so, let me know so we can get this adventure started. Please send me at least a few sentences about yourself and your situation so I know you're real. Thanks for reading this and have a wonderful day.

title: Long Distance Pen Pal
text:
I'll try my best to describe what I'd like, but I think the right person will understand. First of all, I"m not looking to meet. Where I am is not particularly relevant, but let's just say it's way too far for a meeting, even if I was interested. Basically, I'm looking for conversations that are outside our daily lives, the stuff you wouldn't normally voice out loud. This encompasses so many things, which I'm not going to list, but let's just say I speak my mind, No topic is off limits or "too soon" if it's funny. 

For the most part, I miss laughing. I had an on-line friend for about two years, and we used to have a lot of these weird conversations- and about our daily lives too- but I mostly miss those random, uninhibited thoughts that showed me who he really was. That's my take on it anyway- most of what we show the world on a daily basis is the version of "us" that is socially acceptable. I'd like to find someone who accepts me even if it doesn't always sound safe or sane. I'd like to do the same for you.

If you think this is for you, please feel free to introduce yourself, and include the same stats I've listed about myself in this ad. Oh, two things: 1) Please be a decent writer, who will write more than two sentences of "text speak". I will not respond to one- two line emails, or retarded questions like "Are you real?"; 2) Please have time to write more than once in a blue moon. I think once a day is reasonable, given all the responsibilities we have at home and work. It could be more on some days, but if you expect frequent emails every day, I'm not the one.

Finally, please don't be offended if I don't respond. It's not personal, it's Craigslist. In any case, thank you for taking the time to read my ad.

title: ___ Nobody takes me seriously and this is why, as odd as it sounds...
text:
There are many pitfalls that threaten long term relationships and as silly as this may seem, and without attempting to be facetious, I seem to be shooting myself in the foot with a seemingly unlikely offender - great sex. 

I can hear you bust out in laughter & disbelief as you cry 'bullshit!'. Trust me, I'd be calling foul on this if I wasn't the one experiencing the phenomena. But if you're still with me and willing to concede that great sex can be an obstacle in a ltr, allow me to elaborate. 

A few times, as most do, I jumped into the sexual part of a relationship right away. Inevitably the unions were short lived because I'd established this aspect of ourselves without being able to build any sort of foundation for a ltr. It became quite apparent that we enjoyed ourselves in this capacity without the need to establish anything else, and while I tried to step back long enough to build upon things that would lead to longevity, the tenuous relationship we had built was based on sex alone. Ironically, my partner felt so satisfied in this arena that nothing else mattered. However, that was empty and lonely for me as I happen to view the concept of intimacy as more than orgasmic pleasure. 

So, I wised up and decided that no matter the sexual chemistry, I would not allow myself to introduce sex into the next relationship. I have to say that's a lot easier said than done! I mean, when the sexual attraction is there, the tension can become quite monumental! Still, I prevailed and we went 8 dates without entering the bedroom. Part of her was skeptical as most guys are ready to jump in bed on day 1 but the skepticism disappeared once we entered that realm. And yes, it was amazing! I sometimes wonder if the anticipation of waiting made it that much better. Regardless, whatever it was, we soon fell victim to the 'problem' of well...f---ing and nothing more. 

So it seems like no matter which avenue I pursue in dating, the relationship ends up being toxic because the only thing I'm good for is f---ing! I know...poor me, right? Having someone who wants to knock boots morning, day and night. It isn't as though I dislike sex. On the contrary, I'm open minded about sex, enjoy the connection with one person and find it to be such an amazing part of a ltr. However, it isn't everything.

Seriously though, I'm sure women have felt the same feeling of 'I'm just good enough to screw but not much else?' and well, that leaves a lot of emptiness in a relationship. I aim to please my partner, take care of my body and listen to the things she needs and wants in bed but also look to support her in times of crisis or offer guidance when she's lost. 

How do people get around being just considered good for 'one thing'?? I genuinely ask this because at this point, I'm skeptical of women who are interested in me, and it's not that I'm rejecting them as individuals, I'm projecting unfairly unto them. 

I'd welcome your comments if you've face a similar situation in the past or currently. Please no spam or porn invites. I realize this is CL and I'm opening up to all sorts of potential asinine replies, but if you can't say something nice, please keep it to yourself. Otherwise, I appreciate constructive criticism. 

Thanks for reading!

title: Golf partner, mountain biker, movie dinner companion
text:
Hey, I may be built like a 5'11" stocky, muscular guy who loves great craft beer and good bourbon, but I'm still quite athletic. If you think you can keep up with me on a 15 mile ride, love to golf and are open to trying new movies (sorry, but I "prefer" PG-13, good man here) or restaurants, then we should at least talk. I'm a devoted Christian gentleman, love my weekly contemporary, hip, non-denominational church (you're welcome to visit or invite me to yours), enjoy cooking, respect women, hold doors, and I serve my church and community as a volunteer for senior shut-ins and the homeless. But I can still be a bit of a wonderfully sarcastic bad-ass as I've seen and done too much back in the day. 

I'm a conservative guy, seeking an athletic female friend (hwp is fine), one who'll be open to talking about intellectual items in the news, politics, faith, psychology or the differences between men and women, and if I can help you with your struggles in understanding men better (or you can give me a window to the emotionally complex female mind), then that might be a good thing for us. I'm going through a divorce myself, so I'm not looking for dating, just a straight exercise/fun times female friend, but no atheists/earth mother types please. I'm not going to hit on you, but respect you and get to know you. Just looking for platonic right now. By the way, I'm a 30 year drummer who can jive, swing dance or waltz so I'm a kick-ass wedding date if I don't say so myself (if you're looking for just that too, I'm open despite the rest of the ad - I love to dance).

More about me, I'm quite witty, somewhat charming, just turned 47, feel like 30, enjoy weight lifting and will be playing 12" softball this summer. I am also an educated, professional man who works in higher education with a solid job. Bonus points if you love the outdoors, hike, canoe, fish or camp (I do have years of tent camping, but own a pop-up and take the kayak and mountain bike with). Decent looking (ok, sorta cute), well-mannered and 100% authentic guy (lies are too hard to remember). Give it a shot, I don't judge, and I'm not looking to date you, just play a few rounds of golf or whatever with a genuine, respectable lady (even if this is a more recent development, we all can improve). I've got great friends that are married or divorced and dedicated to their children (with limited time), so I am open to age, and just want to be able to congratulate your tee shot by buying the first round at the 19th hole (unless you want to treat in honor of that straight-as-an-arrow 200 yarder I got lucky hitting). Sorry, I can smell players and not looking to be a sugar daddy either so if that's what you want, please pass. 

Send a message with Hey Crazy Dude as the subject. Thanks.

title: Nerds, Artists, Gamers, Cooks and Intelligent People!
text:
Hello!

So I am looking to find some really amazing people to hang out with more frequently outside of my current circle of friends. I am fine with both girls and guys (as long as you are not looking for something sexual or otherwise - I have been in a happy relationship for 6 years and am not looking!). I work from home as a freelance concept artist/ illustrator, so I have a more flexible schedule where I can be free afternoons, evenings and weekends when I want. I'd love to find someone who would like to just hang out at the apartment keeping each other company, playing games, watching Netflix etc. Also, my boyfriend and I host board game nights sometimes, and we'd love to find people who might be interested in that as well! (If you are allergic to cats, I have two of them... just a note)

Some things that we would ideally have in common:

Love of video games
Ditto for board games
Interest in digital art and animation (I graduated in animation and I love cartoons and animated movies!)
Reading books - they are so awesome and we should all read more
Cooking - I really enjoy cooking at home, and trying out new recipes and I'd love if I had a competent partner to help me cook sometimes together
Photography - I just got a new camera and I'd love to go out and learn it's workings with a friend
Being friendly, enjoying a great conversation about nothing or everything, visiting some new restaurants without breaking the bank, and just being an interesting person. 

Please don't smoke, I am seriously allergic. Also, if you are in the suburbs, I don't have a car and really dislike traveling 2 hours on the train, so you would have to be willing to visit me in the city. If you are friendly, kind of nerdy, or just like what you hear, feel free to message me. The response has to be more than two sentences and coherent (it's hard to get a read on someone who writes " yo, i b same." ) Put Ratatouille in the subject line, so I know you aren't a robot. 

I look forward to hearing from you!

title: Lady seeks pen pal now, flat mate this summer
text:
I'll be moving back to Chicago this summer. I haven't been in a situation where I've had to look for someone to live with in a very long time, and now that I'm older (mid 30s), I'm not totally comfortable just picking an apartment and living with whoever has a room.

What I'd like to do is start "meeting" people now-- before I return. While where I live is important, the person I will be sharing that space with is of even greater importance. 

I am painfully normal. I don't smoke, drink, use drugs or even drink coffee (or cola, or black tea). I once explained what I do all day to someone and he said it sounded like "an idyllic existence." I have been described as "primitive" due to my preference for being functionally fit as opposed to wasting time in a gym trying to keep up appearances. 

My favourite places in Chicago are the Caldwell lily pool, Kings Sweets on Devon, the Cultural Center and the Music Box. I check out CPL library books and read them on my tablet, even though I haven't lived in Chicago for years. I love the CTA, and literally have dreams about it.

I love my dog. Hopefully, you will love my dog. I love to feed people. Hopefully, you love when someone else cooks for you. 

I'm non-white. I don't particularly care what you are, but I know it matters a lot to many people who use CL. I think it's a sad, sad shame, but my opinion is mine and yours is yours. I'm a woman, but this is the platonic section, so I would be happy to hear from men or women. One of my female friends killed herself and the other two moved to the south side. They have kids. The rest of my friends are men. Several of them have kids or have left the state/country. Or both. I feel comfortable with men who view me as a person first, and then belatedly remember I am also a woman years later. I don't have to worry about "putting on my face" that way. 

I don't play an instrument, but I consider a trip to see CSO a treat. I would love to live with someone who plays an instrument (not "in a band") and plays it well. A string maybe. I can't drive or sew and those are things I would love to do. I lived with the conviction that I am 5'6. Then I realised I'm not. I'm barely out of petite height. One of my friends suggested I labored under this delusion because I treat people as though I'm taller than I am. I wasn't quite sure how to take that, so I let it go. 

i love cats. I can not live with them. I hate smoking. I can not live with it. Sometimes I have to wake up early to clean. You may hear me start a loaf of bread at 5 in the morning, leave it to rise and go back to bed.

I'm not even supposed to eat bread. 


Your turn.

title: Life is beautiful so why live it alone.
text:
Hello! 
Life is beautiful to be living it alone. There are so many things one can do with a partner like go on adventures and explore new parts of the world. 

I am not a huge fan on using Craiglist for this, but when meeting people in the real world or even given online dating shot fails, then what else is there left to do? The reason it has failed is because online dating is more about looks and just hooking up then actually having a connection first. Many people are scared to talk or just want to have sex. It is a deal breaker indeed. 
Anyways, I'm looking for someone who to make a deep connection. See if we share common interests. Start by exchanging emails. Then maybe talk on the phone or text. Build some trust and then eventually meet and go on a date. I really mean a date not some hideous bar and get a drink. I don't think that is the type of environment for a first date unless you have different intentions. 

A little bit about me is that I am very picky. I have been told by everyone that I know. I just crave that connection. That conversation that attracts you to someone else. 

When you exchange word by word with someone to the point where you enjoy reading everything they have written to you. When you talk to them you just sit there and enjoy listening to them. I know all this is kinda hard to find but I have had that connection before so I know it is possible. 

I'm the type of guy that in his free time like exploring new parts of the world. I enjoy going out for runs and cooking. I'm very adventurous. I enjoy the little things in life. I can be reading a book on a Friday night or going on an adventure somewhere interesting. 

If you sound like the person that is into intellectual conversation and is ready to take the next step in your life then don't hesitate to send me an email. Tell me why it caught your attention. Also, to weep out those annoying robots who always send you an email and just want you to reply to another email. Put on the subject line your name and age so it does not go to my trash. 

By the way I am not a robot and I have read post on here that write that and then they say that to prove it , that it is sunny outside or the temperature. I will just say that I'm happy with my life right now but getting to know someone would not be a bad idea.

You find a bottle on the beach. (I suppose it's bad form for me to emote on your behalf, but it's just for the prologue, I promise this is the last time, but for sake of getting to the point...) You reach down and pick it up, noticing a small brown parchment inside. You fish it out, unfurl and smooth it out on the edge of a park-bench. title: Chicago Tour Guide Available...Make Memories...Have an Adventure!
text:
Would you like to make your visit to Chicago memorable and delightful? My name is Bill. I was born and bred in one of the greatest cities in the world...Chicago, Illinois and I love showing off my hometown. Is there anything special that you'd like to see or do while you're here? Make a list of the things that you would enjoy seeing and doing or allow me to suggest places of interest for you. I will chauffeur you around town and/or the surrounding suburbs and show you everything and anything my city has to offer. I am a very good driver. I have a fully insured Hyundai Santa Fe SUV and a clean driving record. I am familiar with all of the basic tourist attractions and I have extensive knowledge about restaurants (we have plenty of great eateries of almost every ethnicity imaginable), bars/taverns, shopping areas, lesser known hidden gems and much more. 

My fees are reasonable and negotiable. I am sane, safe, dependable, humorous and always a gentleman. Stellar references from several out of town visitors are available upon request. 

Enjoy your stay in Chicago! Airport pick up/drop off service is available and if you are traveling alone I can also be a breakfast, lunch or dinner companion. Thank you for considering my services.
