title: Fellow Nerd/Geek Wanted
text:
Looking for someone to go to meetups with and do online classes through MOOCS (Massive Open Online Courses) in UX/UX. I work for a wireless provider but in my spare time I'm starting to delve deeper into the UX/UI space. So I've bookmarked some free online courses on UX/UI, Agile Principles and similar areas through EDx, Coursea and Open 2 Study.

What I'm looking for is someone whose interested in taking some of these courses with me and attending meetups (through meetup.com or other sources) and just geeking out and learning and growing our skills. You don't necessarily have to be interested in UX/UI but some sort of tech related field would be nice. Eventually I do want to do a project such as working with a small business or community organization to make a mockup of their website. 

Until March 27th my schedule is free only on Wednesday and Thursday as I work Friday through Tuesday from 11-8pm. But I can do Google Hangout sessions or Skype periodically on these days. On March 27th my work schedule will be 1-10pm Tuesday through Friday and 12-9 on Saturday with Sunday and Monday off. 

A little about me:
-I like gadgets and technology especially devices.
-I frequently change my devices. For example at the start of the year I had a MacBook Air, an iPhone 6s Plus, Galaxy S6 Edge and a Sony Smartwatch 3. And now currently I'm rocking a Surface Pro 3, a Nexus 6P and still have my S6 Edge, a Nexus 7 and a Pebble Time Smartwatch.
-I'm always reading Flipboard or some other news app for the latest trends, apps and gadgets.
-I hate coding but love being around coders (ironic I know)
-I love listening to EDM, Hardstyle, DnB, Dubstep and the Liquid variations

Mmmmm, what else:
-AA
-28
-5' 5"
-Athletic
-I don't have my degree yet but you'd think I did and I'm always learning on my own anyway
-Prefer bike riding over driving (car or bike will be coming soon for me though)
.........Anything else just reach out to me. 


I've already started one course in UX on Open 2 Study but it would be really great to share the experience with someone else and see what we can learn and discover. So hopefully I'll hear from you soon. Laters

title: Fairy Tales of CL
text:
Ah the fairy tales of CL. How many tales can be found on here? I'm guessing plenty with plenty of them as dead ends to spam. So what brings me here to chat about this? I guess it is my way to just drift off to fantasy. What is my fantasy or fairy tale that I would like from CL you might wonder or ask? I would say it probably isn't any different than any of the other married white males on here. Looking for that fwb. Only I somehow think I'm different. I would like to find a friend. Someone to relate with. Someone to talk about things where there isn't judgment. Someone to just allow me to be me and her to be her. title: I know you're tired of not having that perfect guy friend...
text:
Let's face it.. Since the beginning of time, there's been this weird thing about guys and gals and friendship..

Forget all that, because I've had amazing female friends in the past.. but that was in highschool. 

We'd be laughing all the time because we knew what made each other laugh, we'd always poke fun at each other, talk crap to each other and tease each other.. 

You know, the type to get separated by the teacher and moved to the far sides of the room because we'd always be talking and laughing and whispering while the teacher was trying to teach

and when we got into problems with other guys or other females, we'd have each others backs like "you woulda kicked his ass.. i know it.. good thing u didnt fight though" or "she's just hating because she wishes she can be like you".. that moral support thats far more validating than when it's coming from friends of your own gender..

However, life takes us down paths, we learn lessons and life isn't as simple as it was back in highschool.. and some of us don't go to college.. 

What I'm like: ALOT to handle for some.. But an amazing personality, great sense of humor, sarcastic, confident, tough but also a goofball, caring, considering, but also a loveable asshole

My preference: I'm open to every race.. especially girls who are a little ADD, because i'm the same way ... we're different than most and we have way more fun. If you get along with guys more than gals, maybe that'll help too.

title: I Want More Than Platonic
text:
Before anyone jumps on me for this, I know I'm in the platonic section, but I've tried the other ones and there seems to be no real people over there so as a last resort, I'm over here. I wish there was an easy way to explain what I'm looking for, and a proper category to post in, but there isn't. I want to find a friend, a companion, a buddy to goof around with and yes...a lover. I am your basic, everyday, normal American male. I am married, (which isn't going well and why I'm here) 48 years old, and doing my best to stay in shape. I have what I consider to be a good outlook on life, all things considered. I can be serious when the situation calls for it, but a crazy knucklehead as well. I love making people laugh and enjoy being spontaneous. 

Now about you. Looks, race and age don't really matter as long as we can connect on many different levels. Be ready to talk and communicate. You don't have to be a genius, but have your own opinions on things and be confident enough to express them. Sarcasm is great and a little flirtatious is always nice. Other than that, just be yourself. We can figure the rest out as we go along.

So what do you think? Is this you? Am I someone you've been looking for? If so, let me know so we can get this adventure started. Please send me at least a few sentences about yourself and your situation so I know you're real. Thanks for reading this and have a wonderful day.

title: Travel companion/assistant
text:
I have recently bought a business franchise and I am finally proud to call myself a business owner.


I am looking for a travel companion, a business associate/assistant to accompany me to a mandatory business training that will take place March 28 to April 1st. in Atlanta GA.
Food and lodging is provided by the Company for the time being, traveling is my expense. However, since traveling alone would not cost any more than having someone travel with me, I've thought I would offer this possibility (or opportunity) to someone like minded ,entrepreneurial spirit who would like to partake in a very lucrative and fun business as an assistant (hired employee).

There is absolutely no monetary contribution necessary from your part , since I am the sole owner of this business (as a franchisee), you will only work as an employee (part time or full time if you wish).

The nature of this business :-- teaching kids sports. (student ages 3-10) as an afterschool enrichment program . We will be teaching in day-cares , kindergardens and/or elementary schools.

I already have 5 merchants accounts locked into this program ,that are very eager and excited for me (us) to introduce them to this curriculum.( this was part of the franchise agreement from the Company to boost-start my business).
More details about this business will be disclosed to you in person (if you prove to be the right candidate)

Expectations ( since I hate to use the word :- requirement) from your part are the following(s):-
-- You must love working with kids. (very very important)
-- You must have a positive attitude, easy-to-get-along with personality, be approachable,
trustworthy and reliable.
-- You must be passionate about working with kids, ready to bring a lot of enthusiasm, optimism and energy into group effort.
-- You must love sports (tennis, golf) , be active and in shape.

You will be trained with me at the training about how to conduct a class and how to teach the two sports (kids level tennis and golf).

Let me know if this would be something you'd be interested in learning and pursuing as a side job or even as a main career.

Again, more details will be discussed once we meet .
Email me with all the questions you have ( and I hope and expect you to have a few at very least).

title: Define friends
text:
Whenever my friends would ask "Why would you rather go out with her, instead of them?" I'd give them that look. That look that says "Why would they ask again, when they already know the answer?" Fortunately, they know why. I'd rather be going to concerts, road trips and building snow forts instead of doing what they always want to do. Which of course, is playing video games or watching tv. Which I could do but sometimes I'd rather be with you. 

After all, we're also friends. You'd always be into some funny stuff, like going on random trips with no plans or waking me up in the middle of the night to go out and play laser tag or something. Me being crazy as you sometimes, would be up for it. However, you would always help someone out of a jam, brave enough to get dirty to someone's aid and you know how to silence your phone and be quiet during a movie. You can care less about social media because you have good friends. People always thought you had a boyfriend, including me, but we were always good friends. Wonder whether you're still on that adventure. 

Friends like you are hard to find but here I am looking. Are you someone who would make a good friend, be up for some grand adventures, always have your friend's back and are serious about being friends in real life? What you waiting on? Email me. I've posted this ad a few times in the past and actually made plans a few times, but in the end it has always fallen through. However, recent experiences have taught me that life is really too short not to try again.

This is a long-standing and ultimately pretty innocent fantasy. I'm looking for an attractive. confident BBW, dressed to the nines, who'll invite me over to her place, strip me down to my underwear and hit me with a bunch of pies. I will pie you in return if you want, but it's not essential. What I've described above is as far as I expect anything to go. If you have other interests that can easily be incorporated into this scenario, I'm open to that, but I put this ad in Strictly Platonic because those are my expectations.

If you aren't a BBW and still want to do this we can discuss it, although the "W" portion of BBW is non-negotiable. And if you're a size 6 or under, this is the rare ad that isn't for you -- for some reason I've always imagined a BBW doing the pieing. If you're a cute BBW who's also a psychologist and can give me some insight into why I've wanted to do this for something like 20 years, you'll go to the front of the line.

title: Looking for someone fun and active
text:
Hi,

I am a divorced white man, living on the south side of the city. I am seeking a white female close to my age that is active and likes to stay in shape. I like to spend time bicycling and walking along the lakefront and go to the gym regularly. I can not run, the impact to my knees is too much. But I can play tennis, not very good, volley ball, etc. Otherwise looking for an active woman that enjoys the outdoors and staying in shape.

I also eat healthy and starting to lean towards a more vegetarian diet, I still enjoy fish and chicken. I drink socially, but do not do drugs or smoke. Beside exercising and eating healthy, I also like going to see live bands, museums, sports, and just checking out new places in the city.

This is the platonic section, I am not seeking a hook up, FWB, marriage, etc. I am seeking a woman that has her life together, in good shaped, and most importantly MATURE. If you are looking for a good, kind, and fun man to spend time having fun, breaking a sweat, and enjoying a few laughs I would really like to hear from you.

Well this is CL which means I will get a ton of spams. Please put your favorite activity in the subject line and tell me a little about yourself.

title: ___ Nobody takes me seriously and this is why, as odd as it sounds...
text:
There are many pitfalls that threaten long term relationships and as silly as this may seem, and without attempting to be facetious, I seem to be shooting myself in the foot with a seemingly unlikely offender - great sex. 

I can hear you bust out in laughter & disbelief as you cry 'bullshit!'. Trust me, I'd be calling foul on this if I wasn't the one experiencing the phenomena. But if you're still with me and willing to concede that great sex can be an obstacle in a ltr, allow me to elaborate. 

A few times, as most do, I jumped into the sexual part of a relationship right away. Inevitably the unions were short lived because I'd established this aspect of ourselves without being able to build any sort of foundation for a ltr. It became quite apparent that we enjoyed ourselves in this capacity without the need to establish anything else, and while I tried to step back long enough to build upon things that would lead to longevity, the tenuous relationship we had built was based on sex alone. Ironically, my partner felt so satisfied in this arena that nothing else mattered. However, that was empty and lonely for me as I happen to view the concept of intimacy as more than orgasmic pleasure. 

So, I wised up and decided that no matter the sexual chemistry, I would not allow myself to introduce sex into the next relationship. I have to say that's a lot easier said than done! I mean, when the sexual attraction is there, the tension can become quite monumental! Still, I prevailed and we went 8 dates without entering the bedroom. Part of her was skeptical as most guys are ready to jump in bed on day 1 but the skepticism disappeared once we entered that realm. And yes, it was amazing! I sometimes wonder if the anticipation of waiting made it that much better. Regardless, whatever it was, we soon fell victim to the 'problem' of well...f---ing and nothing more. 

So it seems like no matter which avenue I pursue in dating, the relationship ends up being toxic because the only thing I'm good for is f---ing! I know...poor me, right? Having someone who wants to knock boots morning, day and night. It isn't as though I dislike sex. On the contrary, I'm open minded about sex, enjoy the connection with one person and find it to be such an amazing part of a ltr. However, it isn't everything.

Seriously though, I'm sure women have felt the same feeling of 'I'm just good enough to screw but not much else?' and well, that leaves a lot of emptiness in a relationship. I aim to please my partner, take care of my body and listen to the things she needs and wants in bed but also look to support her in times of crisis or offer guidance when she's lost. 

How do people get around being just considered good for 'one thing'?? I genuinely ask this because at this point, I'm skeptical of women who are interested in me, and it's not that I'm rejecting them as individuals, I'm projecting unfairly unto them. 

I'd welcome your comments if you've face a similar situation in the past or currently. Please no spam or porn invites. I realize this is CL and I'm opening up to all sorts of potential asinine replies, but if you can't say something nice, please keep it to yourself. Otherwise, I appreciate constructive criticism. 

Thanks for reading!

title: I know you're tired of not having that perfect guy friend...
text:
Let's face it.. Since the beginning of time, there's been this weird thing about guys and gals and friendship..

Forget all that, because I've had amazing female friends in the past.. but that was in highschool. 

We'd be laughing all the time because we knew what made each other laugh, we'd always poke fun at each other, talk crap to each other and tease each other.. 

You know, the type to get separated by the teacher and moved to the far sides of the room because we'd always be talking and laughing and whispering while the teacher was trying to teach

and when we got into problems with other guys or other females, we'd have each others backs like "you woulda kicked his ass.. i know it.. good thing u didnt fight though" or "she's just hating because she wishes she can be like you".. that moral support thats far more validating than when it's coming from friends of your own gender..

However, life takes us down paths, we learn lessons and life isn't as simple as it was back in highschool.. and some of us don't go to college.. 

What I'm like: ALOT to handle for some.. But an amazing personality, great sense of humor, sarcastic, confident, tough but also a goofball, caring, considering, but also a loveable asshole

My preference: I'm open to every race.. especially girls who are a little ADD, because i'm the same way ... we're different than most and we have way more fun. If you get along with guys more than gals, maybe that'll help too.

title: Married Man Looking for Married Woman for Sexual or Nonsexual Affiar
text:
How did I get here?

I'm ignored at home. I work every day. I come home to a companion who sits in her permanent spot on the couch with a drink in one hand and her phone in the other. Dinner is in the microwave and there may or not be a beer in the fridge. I eat while she Facebooks and pretends to watch the televison. I reach for the remote only to be denied then I return to my meal as I get a full detailed description of everything that is wrong with her friend's eyebrows in her most recent Instagram picture.

This is my Monday, my Tuesday, my Wednesday, my Thursday...you get the point.

I have a life. And interesting one. I read a lot and the things I read dance in my head and give birth to so many other thoughts and it would be so nice to hear just once, "what's in your mind?"

Do I want intimacy? Of course. Who doesn't like to be pet, kissed, rubbed, hugged, undressed and caressed? 

But let's be honest here. There's only so much s*cking and f*cking that can occur. Even under the influence of C's, V's and/or some good Peruvian, there can be only so much sexy action happening. At some point ,we will have to talk. We will have to discuss something. Even if it's the next roll in the hay.

Conversation. I miss it. I miss the long talks about nothing. The excitement I felt when my notification light blinks and it's a long message about whatever that makes me smile or laugh or better yet, think. I love a good thought provoking email.

I can't bring myself to pay for an adult dating site. I for one don't know if it's worth the investment and I can't help but think after my money is spent, I'll end up talking to an intern assigned to my account that send me nudes stolen for a website in Poland.

So I am here. CL. The last stop the needy and cheap. The place where one is more likely to start a relationship with a Nigerian scam artist rather than a real woman. But I have hope.

I have hope that some internally beautiful woman is still reading and is waiting for me to finish so she can respond and engage me. I have hope that I will see my notification light blink and it's the first of many emails; that leads to a secret meeting that leads to a secret (blank)-ship.

Here's to hope!

title: Joyce, I Miss You
text:
Joyce, it's been just over two years that you've been gone. I can honestly say that I miss you
every day. There are those that feel that the craigslist personals is a hellhole, and I guess I
probably agree, but I met you through CL and it was one of the best things that could have
happened to me. 

I posted an ad seeking a mature woman and through a crazy circumstance you responded. 
For some reason we hit it off immediately. Your mind was open enough to understand my
situation and you shared a bit of your unfortunate situation. We'd been writing for two
weeks when you surprised me by asking when we might meet. We agreed on a time and place
and I was nervous, wondering if I could go through with it. I did, and couldn't have been happier. I
think we probably intended to spend an hour or two making polite conversation. It turned into
six hours and we delved deeply into our lives. I think we were both surprised by the information
we shared but felt relieved that we had each other to talk to. I know we could have stayed and
talked longer but we both needed to get home. I walked you to your car, we shared a few more 
words, then I asked if I may kiss you. It was nice and we kissed again, then we parted. As I
drove away I wanted to go back and see if you were still there. You later told me you sat in
the parking lot a while longer hoping I'd return.

We built a relationship based on friendship. Yes, we were lightly intimate but agreed not to take
things too far. You know...not go all the way, and we were fine with that. Being together seemed
to suit us just fine. Talking, doing small things together, writing at night. All told, we had about
nine months together, then life got in the way. We kept in touch by e-mail and the occasional
phone call. About a week or so after our last call it dawned on me that you hadn't written. For
the fun of it, I googled you name. What I saw felt like a hard punch to the stomach. I saw your
obituary. I think I wanted to cry but couldn't. I'd been taken by surprise. I knew you weren't
entirely healthy but certainly never expected your sudden passing.

Sometimes I'll go for a walk alone and it seems like the sun is shining directly on me. I like to
think that's you smiling at me. I'll step outside in the dark on occasion looking to the southwest
at a particularly bright star. I feel it's you once again and I have to tell you how I feel. 

I never said "I love you". Because we were both married I didn't feel it would be fair to you,
though we sort of joked about it. Now I say it each night. I love you and miss you terribly.

title: friends
text:
Hello, Im looking for friends who enjoy more things than hanging out in boystown. Love to find a guy who likes to see bands at a small venue, the atmosphere at shows is much more intoxicating to me. I also like Small bars where you can actually hear each other. Nothing better then talking about various subjects over a drink or two. Would be nice to meet a guy who is well read so we can have decent conversation.

If you enjoy museums that would be a plus ,the Art Insititue is a fave prob , cause of the painting Nighthawks. Its an amazing painting, speaks about the fear and other feelings of 1940's wartime america. Enjoy walking around the city and check out different neighbourhoods , also fun just looking at the buildings, some amazing ones out there. I do enjoy checking out new photographers and once inawhile try my hand at pics, I usually like to take pics of buildings but im a novice if anything.

In the case of music I think my collection is eclectic. I can only pin down one style that is my fav but there are so many sub-genres of it, I love punk so you can see that style leads off into to so many other genres lol.

Flim is another area that I hope to meet guys who like the odd indie film or even the really dumb films like 'They Live' or 'Army of Darkness' , I do enjoy most genres. I do love the classics , film noir is to die for , check out 'the Third Man' , the 'The Killers' , Odd Man Out amazin stuff. Have been watching a lot of classics of late , James Gagney is the king of cool gangster. Foreign films can be cool too , one of my fav french ones is Le Grand Illusions.

Oh I really like old time radio , some are my favs are X-minus One , The Third Man , The Whistler , and anything with Orson Wells. Some of those shows take you further than any film out there , hell it is true about the theater of the mind is much more fantastic

I'm a 41-year-old nutritionist and nutrition writer living in Ravenswood. I'm self-employed and work most of my days alone, so I find meeting quality folks for coffee or dinner sometimes challenging. 

Right now I'm aspiring to become more thoughtful, kind, vulnerable, and authentic (knowing Brene Brown's books help here.) Really, a spiritual journey (I do Transcendental Meditation and yoga regularly) to become a better, kinder, more thoughtful person.

My favorite things are pretty simple: Museums, movies (tend towards art/ foreign), plays/ musicals, reading, writing, meditation, wandering new neighborhoods, long walks, and good meals (but definitely not a foodie). Looking forward to the nicer weather to wander neighborhoods. 

I'm low-key, quiet at first but fairly easy to get to know, prefer small groups but mostly one-on-one rather than massive gatherings.

I'm a gay male, but that doesn't really matter. Straight, female, or otherwise who can strike up an intelligent conversation becomes a wonderful start. Please be in your 30s, 40s, or 50s. I just find more in common with that age range.

Let's start with a few emails and see whether we click. Please describe yourself. Ideally something developing into platonic friendship would be wonderful.

Thanks for reading and I look forward to hearing from you. Jason

title: Looking for Friends
text:
GWM, looking for a new friend or two who would be interested in meeting for dinner, coffee, or a beer; attending concerts, festivals, museums, and other cultural experiences; taking short road trips to explore the world around us (well, whatever subset of the world can be explored from Chicago on a tank of gas or less); or just hanging out.

I work in a professional occupation and have a technology background. When not working I am involved in a few technical hobbies and volunteer work in my community, and (surprise!) I read, listen to music, and consume various other media. I'm fascinated by offbeat roadside attractions and the history and development of factories, roads, bridges, railroads, and airports. I tend to connect best with people who spend their leisure time on hobbies, crafts, music, art, or some other creative activities. I don't follow sports, celebrities, award shows, or social-media memes, and I don't watch much TV.

I like food but I'm not a "foodie". Fine dining is fine, but so is a good diner. I prefer good food and friendly service over vibe and ambiance, steak over sizzle, independents over chains, French toast over quiche, Gene & Jude's over Five Guys, and dog food over Pizza Hut.

Infrequent drinker. Non-smoker.

I hope to meet people who are smart, funny, and adventurous (though I am not).

Strictly platonic. I am not looking for dates, "dates", or hook-ups. Which means I'm not particular about your age, sex, or looks. And I'm not too concerned about your relationship status, as long as you have some free time to get together and do things, and you're in control of your own social calendar.

If interested, please drop me a line and let me know something about yourself, including your location and what you do for fun.

Thanks.

text:
Hi,

So here I am, hoping to find people who are like-minded (a huge plus if you're a musician, but not necessary) who are looking for someone like me! title: I Want More Than Platonic
text:
Before anyone jumps on me for this, I know I'm in the platonic section, but I've tried the other ones and there seems to be no real people over there so as a last resort, I'm over here. I wish there was an easy way to explain what I'm looking for, and a proper category to post in, but there isn't. I want to find a friend, a companion, a buddy to goof around with and yes...a lover. I am your basic, everyday, normal American male. I am married, (which isn't going well and why I'm here) 48 years old, and doing my best to stay in shape. I have what I consider to be a good outlook on life, all things considered. I can be serious when the situation calls for it, but a crazy knucklehead as well. I love making people laugh and enjoy being spontaneous. 

Now about you. Looks, race and age don't really matter as long as we can connect on many different levels. Be ready to talk and communicate. You don't have to be a genius, but have your own opinions on things and be confident enough to express them. Sarcasm is great and a little flirtatious is always nice. Other than that, just be yourself. We can figure the rest out as we go along.

So what do you think? Is this you? Am I someone you've been looking for? If so, let me know so we can get this adventure started. Please send me at least a few sentences about yourself and your situation so I know you're real. Thanks for reading this and have a wonderful day.

title: Long Distance Pen Pal
text:
I'll try my best to describe what I'd like, but I think the right person will understand. First of all, I"m not looking to meet. Where I am is not particularly relevant, but let's just say it's way too far for a meeting, even if I was interested. Basically, I'm looking for conversations that are outside our daily lives, the stuff you wouldn't normally voice out loud. This encompasses so many things, which I'm not going to list, but let's just say I speak my mind, No topic is off limits or "too soon" if it's funny. 

For the most part, I miss laughing. I had an on-line friend for about two years, and we used to have a lot of these weird conversations- and about our daily lives too- but I mostly miss those random, uninhibited thoughts that showed me who he really was. That's my take on it anyway- most of what we show the world on a daily basis is the version of "us" that is socially acceptable. I'd like to find someone who accepts me even if it doesn't always sound safe or sane. I'd like to do the same for you.

If you think this is for you, please feel free to introduce yourself, and include the same stats I've listed about myself in this ad. Oh, two things: 1) Please be a decent writer, who will write more than two sentences of "text speak". I will not respond to one- two line emails, or retarded questions like "Are you real?"; 2) Please have time to write more than once in a blue moon. I think once a day is reasonable, given all the responsibilities we have at home and work. It could be more on some days, but if you expect frequent emails every day, I'm not the one.

Finally, please don't be offended if I don't respond. It's not personal, it's Craigslist. In any case, thank you for taking the time to read my ad.

title: Golf partner, mountain biker, movie dinner companion
text:
Hey, I may be built like a 5'11" stocky, muscular guy who loves great craft beer and good bourbon, but I'm still quite athletic. If you think you can keep up with me on a 15 mile ride, love to golf, know what fun swing dancing is, or are open to trying new movies (I prefer PG-13) or restaurants, then we should at least talk. I'm a Christian guy who loves my contemporary, hip, non-denominational church (you're welcome to visit or invite me to yours), enjoy cooking, respect women, hold doors, and I serve my church and community as a volunteer for senior shut-ins and the homeless. But I can still be a bit of a creatively sarcastic wise-guy as I've seen and done too much back in the day. 

I'm a conservative guy now, seeking an athletic female friend (hwp is fine), one who'll be open to talking about intellectual items in the news, politics, faith, psychology or the differences between men and women, and if I can help you with your struggles in understanding men better (or you can give me a window to the emotionally complex female mind), then that might be a good thing for us. I'm going through a divorce myself, so I'm not looking for dating, just a straight exercise/fun times female friend, but no atheists/earth mother hippie types please. I'm not going to hit on you, but respect you and get to know you. Just looking for platonic right now. 

I can be witty, somewhat charming, and just turned 47 but feel like 30, enjoy weight lifting and will be playing 12" softball this summer. I am an educated, professional man with a decent job. Bonus points if you love the outdoors, hike, canoe, fish or camp. Decent looking (ok, sorta cute), well-mannered and 100% authentic guy (lies are too hard to remember). Hello!

So I am looking to find some really amazing people to hang out with more frequently outside of my current circle of friends. I'd love to find someone who would like to just hang out at the apartment keeping each other company, playing games, watching Netflix etc. Also, my boyfriend and I host board game nights sometimes, and we'd love to find people who might be interested in that as well! Some things that we would ideally have in common:

Love of video games
Ditto for board games
Interest in digital art and animation (I graduated in animation and I love cartoons and animated movies!)

Cooking - I really enjoy cooking at home, and trying out new recipes and I'd love if I had a competent partner to help me cook sometimes together
Photography - I just got a new camera and I'd love to go out and learn it's workings with a friend
Being friendly, enjoying a great conversation about nothing or everything, visiting some new restaurants without breaking the bank, and just being an interesting person. 

Please don't smoke, I am seriously allergic. Also, if you are in the suburbs, I don't have a car and really dislike traveling 2 hours on the train, so you would have to be willing to visit me in the city. title: Life is beautiful so why live it alone.
text:
Hello! 
Life is beautiful to be living it alone. There are so many things one can do with a partner like go on adventures and explore new parts of the world. 

I am not a huge fan on using Craiglist for this, but when meeting people in the real world or even given online dating shot fails, then what else is there left to do? The reason it has failed is because online dating is more about looks and just hooking up then actually having a connection first. Many people are scared to talk or just want to have sex. It is a deal breaker indeed. 
Anyways, I'm looking for someone who to make a deep connection. See if we share common interests. Start by exchanging emails. Then maybe talk on the phone or text. Build some trust and then eventually meet and go on a date. I really mean a date not some hideous bar and get a drink. I don't think that is the type of environment for a first date unless you have different intentions. 

A little bit about me is that I am very picky. I have been told by everyone that I know. I just crave that connection. That conversation that attracts you to someone else. 

When you exchange word by word with someone to the point where you enjoy reading everything they have written to you. When you talk to them you just sit there and enjoy listening to them. I know all this is kinda hard to find but I have had that connection before so I know it is possible. 

I'm the type of guy that in his free time like exploring new parts of the world. I enjoy going out for runs and cooking. I'm very adventurous. I enjoy the little things in life. I can be reading a book on a Friday night or going on an adventure somewhere interesting. 

If you sound like the person that is into intellectual conversation and is ready to take the next step in your life then don't hesitate to send me an email. Tell me why it caught your attention. Also, to weep out those annoying robots who always send you an email and just want you to reply to another email. Put on the subject line your name and age so it does not go to my trash. 

By the way I am not a robot and I have read post on here that write that and then they say that to prove it , that it is sunny outside or the temperature. I will just say that I'm happy with my life right now but getting to know someone would not be a bad idea.

My fees are reasonable and negotiable. I am sane, safe, dependable, humorous and always a gentleman. Stellar references from several out of town visitors are available upon request.

What I'm looking for is someone whose interested in taking some of these courses with me and attending meetups (through meetup.com or other sources) and just geeking out and learning and growing our skills. You don't necessarily have to be interested in UX/UI but some sort of tech related field would be nice. Eventually I do want to do a project such as working with a small business or community organization to make a mockup of their website. 

Until March 27th my schedule is free only on Wednesday and Thursday as I work Friday through Tuesday from 11-8pm. But I can do Google Hangout sessions or Skype periodically on these days. On March 27th my work schedule will be 1-10pm Tuesday through Friday and 12-9 on Saturday with Sunday and Monday off. 

A little about me:
-I like gadgets and technology especially devices.
-I frequently change my devices. For example at the start of the year I had a MacBook Air, an iPhone 6s Plus, Galaxy S6 Edge and a Sony Smartwatch 3. And now currently I'm rocking a Surface Pro 3, a Nexus 6P and still have my S6 Edge, a Nexus 7 and a Pebble Time Smartwatch.

Mmmmm, what else:
-AA
-28

-Athletic
-I don't have my degree yet but you'd think I did and I'm always learning on my own anyway
-Prefer bike riding over driving (car or bike will be coming soon for me though)
.........Anything else just reach out to me. 


I've already started one course in UX on Open 2 Study but it would be really great to share the experience with someone else and see what we can learn and discover. So hopefully I'll hear from you soon. Laters

title: Fairy Tales of CL
text:
Ah the fairy tales of CL. How many tales can be found on here? I'm guessing plenty with plenty of them as dead ends to spam. So what brings me here to chat about this? I guess it is my way to just drift off to fantasy. What is my fantasy or fairy tale that I would like from CL you might wonder or ask? I would say it probably isn't any different than any of the other married white males on here. Looking for that fwb. Only I somehow think I'm different. I would like to find a friend. Someone to relate with. Someone to talk about things where there isn't judgment. Someone to just allow me to be me and her to be her. Oh and someone that would be local and not blow my cover as per the verse in the Eagles song. Sure I have chatted with women and have met a few but they never seem to fulfill what I have hoped for. Usually they live 1-2 hours away. Never are they close by. That never happens. Most of the time the responses I get are from a bot telling me to "click" here to verify that I am who I am. HA HA.....no can do. Are you nuts? Why would I want to pay for something. I'm not looking for just sex. I'm looking for a friend. Yes my CL friends....if you exist......It is all a Fairy Tale of CL.

Maybe you have a fairy tale you would like to share with me of your CL experience......

title: I know you're tired of not having that perfect guy friend...
text:
Let's face it.. Since the beginning of time, there's been this weird thing about guys and gals and friendship..

Forget all that, because I've had amazing female friends in the past.. but that was in highschool. 

We'd be laughing all the time because we knew what made each other laugh, we'd always poke fun at each other, talk crap to each other and tease each other.. 

You know, the type to get separated by the teacher and moved to the far sides of the room because we'd always be talking and laughing and whispering while the teacher was trying to teach

and when we got into problems with other guys or other females, we'd have each others backs like "you woulda kicked his ass.. i know it.. good thing u didnt fight though" or "she's just hating because she wishes she can be like you".. that moral support thats far more validating than when it's coming from friends of your own gender..

However, life takes us down paths, we learn lessons and life isn't as simple as it was back in highschool.. and some of us don't go to college.. 

What I'm like: ALOT to handle for some.. But an amazing personality, great sense of humor, sarcastic, confident, tough but also a goofball, caring, considering, but also a loveable asshole

My preference: I'm open to every race.. especially girls who are a little ADD, because i'm the same way ... we're different than most and we have way more fun. If you get along with guys more than gals, maybe that'll help too.

title: ___ Nobody takes me seriously and this is why, as odd as it sounds...
text:
There are many pitfalls that threaten long term relationships and as silly as this may seem, and without attempting to be facetious, I seem to be shooting myself in the foot with a seemingly unlikely offender - great sex. 

I can hear you bust out in laughter & disbelief as you cry 'bullshit!'. Trust me, I'd be calling foul on this if I wasn't the one experiencing the phenomena. But if you're still with me and willing to concede that great sex can be an obstacle in a ltr, allow me to elaborate. 

A few times, as most do, I jumped into the sexual part of a relationship right away. Inevitably the unions were short lived because I'd established this aspect of ourselves without being able to build any sort of foundation for a ltr. It became quite apparent that we enjoyed ourselves in this capacity without the need to establish anything else, and while I tried to step back long enough to build upon things that would lead to longevity, the tenuous relationship we had built was based on sex alone. Ironically, my partner felt so satisfied in this arena that nothing else mattered. However, that was empty and lonely for me as I happen to view the concept of intimacy as more than orgasmic pleasure. 

So, I wised up and decided that no matter the sexual chemistry, I would not allow myself to introduce sex into the next relationship. I have to say that's a lot easier said than done! I mean, when the sexual attraction is there, the tension can become quite monumental! Still, I prevailed and we went 8 dates without entering the bedroom. Part of her was skeptical as most guys are ready to jump in bed on day 1 but the skepticism disappeared once we entered that realm. And yes, it was amazing! I sometimes wonder if the anticipation of waiting made it that much better. Regardless, whatever it was, we soon fell victim to the 'problem' of well...f---ing and nothing more. 

So it seems like no matter which avenue I pursue in dating, the relationship ends up being toxic because the only thing I'm good for is f---ing! I know...poor me, right? Having someone who wants to knock boots morning, day and night. It isn't as though I dislike sex. On the contrary, I'm open minded about sex, enjoy the connection with one person and find it to be such an amazing part of a ltr. However, it isn't everything.

Seriously though, I'm sure women have felt the same feeling of 'I'm just good enough to screw but not much else?' and well, that leaves a lot of emptiness in a relationship. I aim to please my partner, take care of my body and listen to the things she needs and wants in bed but also look to support her in times of crisis or offer guidance when she's lost. 

How do people get around being just considered good for 'one thing'?? I genuinely ask this because at this point, I'm skeptical of women who are interested in me, and it's not that I'm rejecting them as individuals, I'm projecting unfairly unto them. 

I'd welcome your comments if you've face a similar situation in the past or currently. Please no spam or porn invites. I realize this is CL and I'm opening up to all sorts of potential asinine replies, but if you can't say something nice, please keep it to yourself. Otherwise, I appreciate constructive criticism. 

Thanks for reading!

title: I know you're tired of not having that perfect guy friend...
text:
Let's face it.. Since the beginning of time, there's been this weird thing about guys and gals and friendship..

Forget all that, because I've had amazing female friends in the past.. but that was in highschool. 

We'd be laughing all the time because we knew what made each other laugh, we'd always poke fun at each other, talk crap to each other and tease each other.. 

You know, the type to get separated by the teacher and moved to the far sides of the room because we'd always be talking and laughing and whispering while the teacher was trying to teach

and when we got into problems with other guys or other females, we'd have each others backs like "you woulda kicked his ass.. i know it.. good thing u didnt fight though" or "she's just hating because she wishes she can be like you".. that moral support thats far more validating than when it's coming from friends of your own gender..

However, life takes us down paths, we learn lessons and life isn't as simple as it was back in highschool.. and some of us don't go to college.. 

What I'm like: ALOT to handle for some.. But an amazing personality, great sense of humor, sarcastic, confident, tough but also a goofball, caring, considering, but also a loveable asshole

My preference: I'm open to every race.. especially girls who are a little ADD, because i'm the same way ... we're different than most and we have way more fun. If you get along with guys more than gals, maybe that'll help too.

title: Travel companion/assistant
text:
I have recently bought a business franchise and I am finally proud to call myself a business owner.


I am looking for a travel companion, a business associate/assistant to accompany me to a mandatory business training that will take place March 28 to April 1st. in Atlanta GA.
Food and lodging is provided by the Company for the time being, traveling is my expense. However, since traveling alone would not cost any more than having someone travel with me, I've thought I would offer this possibility (or opportunity) to someone like minded ,entrepreneurial spirit who would like to partake in a very lucrative and fun business as an assistant (hired employee).

There is absolutely no monetary contribution necessary from your part , since I am the sole owner of this business (as a franchisee), you will only work as an employee (part time or full time if you wish).

The nature of this business :-- teaching kids sports. (student ages 3-10) as an afterschool enrichment program . We will be teaching in day-cares , kindergardens and/or elementary schools.

I already have 5 merchants accounts locked into this program ,that are very eager and excited for me (us) to introduce them to this curriculum.( this was part of the franchise agreement from the Company to boost-start my business).
More details about this business will be disclosed to you in person (if you prove to be the right candidate)

Expectations ( since I hate to use the word :- requirement) from your part are the following(s):-
-- You must love working with kids. (very very important)
-- You must have a positive attitude, easy-to-get-along with personality, be approachable,
trustworthy and reliable.
-- You must be passionate about working with kids, ready to bring a lot of enthusiasm, optimism and energy into group effort.
-- You must love sports (tennis, golf) , be active and in shape. 
--- You must have clean record ( I think that speaks for itself!)

You will be trained with me at the training about how to conduct a class and how to teach the two sports (kids level tennis and golf).

Let me know if this would be something you'd be interested in learning and pursuing as a side job or even as a main career.

Again, more details will be discussed once we meet .
Email me with all the questions you have ( and I hope and expect you to have a few at very least).

T.

title: Muslim or Jewish and Accepting of Lesbian and Transgender Women?
text:
Shalom!

I am a lesbian, which for me means that I am a woman who is romantically and sexually interested in other women; I am a trans woman, meaning that I was designated male at birth; and I am a practicing Jew. I often feel like an outsider among outsiders. While trying to find a place in my faith community, I encounter people who are not understanding of what it is like to be a lesbian or to be trans (although the Jewish people I interact with the most these days tend to be very accepting). When I am in lesbian, gay, bi, trans, or queer (LGBTQ) circles, it seems that many people do not understand why I would want to practice an Abrahamic religion. And in US society at large many people do not understand why I would not want to be a Christian. It would be wonderful to meet people who can relate.

Activities I enjoy include gaming, getting to know people over tea in independent cafes, browsing bookstores, going on long walks, getting close to nature, delving into philosophy, translating the Talmud, and engaging in respectful interfaith dialogue. I enjoy watching same-gender romance movies, including the cheesy ones. I tend to lean far to the left politically on most issues, including the occupation of Palestine. I like congregations that make extensive use of Hebrew, but I am theologically liberal.

I would prefer not to hear from people who believe I am not "really" Jewish because I converted via Reform Judaism. I would also prefer not to hear from people who would treat me as though I am not "really" a woman or "really" a lesbian because I am trans. I respect other people and affirm their identities, and I want to meet people who will show me the same respect.

As lovely as it would be to find a romantic partner, I am posting to the "strictly platonic" section because my main hope is to find friends. I have posted to the "w4w" section because I am generally rather homosocial, but I will consider befriending people of any gender.

title: Are you my new best friend?
text:
Hi there,

This may be a little awkward turning to Craigslist for friends, but I'll give it a shot. To start off, I have an INFJ personality type (which from what I understand is extremely rare). I've always been kind of the quiet one, but that doesn't stop me from enjoying the things I love (and I love a lot of things). Lately I've been kind of bummed that I don't really have any great friends that I talk to or can turn to on a regular basis. My life is full of acquaintances - people that know little about me and don't take an interest in getting to know me more. I have a LOT to offer. I want to find the type of friend who I can text or call randomly and talk to about anything and everything, have adventures with, or even just turn to for advice. Someone who I can talk about my favorite music or movies with. I have a lot of different interests and am always wide open to learning about new things. If this sounds like you, please e-mail me. title: Looking for Friends
text:
GWM, looking for a new friend or two who would be interested in meeting for dinner, coffee, or a beer; attending concerts, festivals, museums, and other cultural experiences; taking short road trips to explore the world around us (well, whatever subset of the world can be explored from Chicago on a tank of gas or less); or just hanging out.

I work in a professional occupation and have a technology background. When not working I am involved in a few technical hobbies and volunteer work in my community, and (surprise!) I read, listen to music, and consume various other media. I'm fascinated by offbeat roadside attractions and the history and development of factories, roads, bridges, railroads, and airports. I tend to connect best with people who spend their leisure time on hobbies, crafts, music, art, or some other creative activities. I don't follow sports, celebrities, award shows, or social-media memes, and I don't watch much TV.

I like food but I'm not a "foodie". Fine dining is fine, but so is a good diner. I prefer good food and friendly service over vibe and ambiance, steak over sizzle, independents over chains, French toast over quiche, Gene & Jude's over Five Guys, and dog food over Pizza Hut.

Infrequent drinker. Non-smoker.

I hope to meet people who are smart, funny, and adventurous (though I am not).

Strictly platonic. I am not looking for dates, "dates", or hook-ups. Which means I'm not particular about your age, sex, or looks. And I'm not too concerned about your relationship status, as long as you have some free time to get together and do things, and you're in control of your own social calendar.

If interested, please drop me a line and let me know something about yourself, including your location and what you do for fun.

Thanks.

title: Life is beautiful so why live it alone.
text:
Hello! 
Life is beautiful to be living it alone. There are so many things one can do with a partner like go on adventures and explore new parts of the world. 

I am not a huge fan on using Craiglist for this, but when meeting people in the real world or even given online dating shot fails, then what else is there left to do? The reason it has failed is because online dating is more about looks and just hooking up then actually having a connection first. Many people are scared to talk or just want to have sex. It is a deal breaker indeed. 
Anyways, I'm looking for someone who to make a deep connection. See if we share common interests. Start by exchanging emails. Then maybe talk on the phone or text. Build some trust and then eventually meet and go on a date. I really mean a date not some hideous bar and get a drink. I don't think that is the type of environment for a first date unless you have different intentions. 

A little bit about me is that I am very picky. I have been told by everyone that I know. I just crave that connection. That conversation that attracts you to someone else. 

When you exchange word by word with someone to the point where you enjoy reading everything they have written to you. When you talk to them you just sit there and enjoy listening to them. I know all this is kinda hard to find but I have had that connection before so I know it is possible. 

I'm the type of guy that in his free time like exploring new parts of the world. I enjoy going out for runs and cooking. I'm very adventurous. I enjoy the little things in life. I can be reading a book on a Friday night or going on an adventure somewhere interesting. 

If you sound like the person that is into intellectual conversation and is ready to take the next step in your life then don't hesitate to send me an email. Tell me why it caught your attention. Also, to weep out those annoying robots who always send you an email and just want you to reply to another email. Put on the subject line your name and age so it does not go to my trash. 

By the way I am not a robot and I have read post on here that write that and then they say that to prove it , that it is sunny outside or the temperature. I will just say that I'm happy with my life right now but getting to know someone would not be a bad idea.

title: I need a teacher...
text:
Okay, so here's the deal: I'm getting ready to move back to my home-state for college. There's this amazing girl back home that is totally into me and I am totally into her... the only problem is that I don't know anything about, well, ANYTHING. I've been in loads of relationships before, but we never really got past the hand-holding part. I've only kissed one person before and that's about the size of it. Jeeze, this is really embarrassing, now that I see it all written down like this... oh, god. 

The point here is: I really wanna be able to do right by this girl. She's amazing and every shade of wonderful. title: ballroom dancing, daytime first
text:
I'm not looking for Ginger Rogers... If you did a little ballroom (foxtrot, swing, waltz, cha-cha, etc) back in school, or even if you can listen to dance music and keep your feet in time that should be enough, I am VERY good at leading with novice dancers. No, I am not a Fred Astaire either, just enjoy moving in synchrony with music and a partner.

For now I am looking to get back to some daytime dances, I've kind of phased out of ballroom, what with doing other kinds of dancing, and other activities during the evening. Hey, if we dance well together, I'd make time for us to dance some evenings or weekends too... And you are welcome to join me in other kinds of dancing.

Next dance to LIVE MUSIC is 1:30-3:00 at the Levy Center in Southwest Evanston on Mar 25. That dance is usually 3rd or 4th Friday of the month. Only $5, what a bargain. The last time I went, it was all couples, though some would trade off and so we could dance with others I expect. 

If Fridays don't work, there are daytime dances to recorded music at other places, Thursday free at Portage Park, Tuesdays with a lesson at 4146 Elston, maybe more.

None of these are fancy "dancing with the stars" kind of ballroom, just friendly social interaction, mostly waltz, foxtrot, swing if I recall correctly. 

It's OK if you are married or in a relationship, this is just to dance. Of course, height, race are open and any but extreme body types. Friendship (movies, theater, museums) would be a plus, going beyond friends is remotely possibly, but unlikely.

If this goes well, we might find other places to dance, including North, West or in Chicago.

title: Strictly platonic? No, but it's just a story.
text:
It was supposed to be a business meeting, but when she showed up I knew focusing on the business at hand would be difficult.
The outfit she chose to wear was in a word, tight and even though there was plenty of fabric it was very revealing.
I know felt even more sloppy in my loose fitting khakis and untucked button-down shirt, two things that I knew in the back of my mind would be helpful in keeping things from getting awkward.
I am not a small guy and I can already feel things coming to attention.
Meeting her in the lobby and she keep her warm soft hands which seemed so small in mine, in my mind her smile and hello seemed more flirtatious than I'm sure they were.
We had met before, and we got along well, she was cute and bubbly but I took this as all part of the sales pitch. But this time was different, no sales to be made, just information, nothing to be gained by distracting me. But still, distracting me seemed like the intent.
I led her to the large conference room and touching me on the shoulder she said "we don't need a big room, isn't there a smaller more private one we can use?"
The sudden shift in my blood flow stopped me in my tracks and what little blood was still there made my mind race. I was almost counting on a big room and large table to keep me focused. But clearly she knew I had a bit of a crush on her and if that was how she wanted to play it then I was game.
----------------
This is just the beginning of the story.
Shall I go on?

title: Message In A Bottle

Depending on your age, you might have the sultry tones of Sting's voice bouncing in your head. And that's aces! Also, sorry for the ear-worm.

Bug I've digressed from my own narrative before even starting. Tsk, tsk self. Here goes...

You find a bottle on the beach. (I suppose it's bad form for me to emote on your behalf, but it's just for the prologue, I promise this is the last time, but for sake of getting to the point...) You reach down and pick it up, noticing a small brown parchment inside. You fish it out, unfurl and smooth it out on the edge of a park-bench. I will pie you in return if you want, but it's not essential. What I've described above is as far as I expect anything to go. If you have other interests that can easily be incorporated into this scenario, I'm open to that, but I put this ad in Strictly Platonic because those are my expectations.

If you aren't a BBW and still want to do this we can discuss it, although the "W" portion of BBW is non-negotiable. title: Married Man Looking for Married Woman for Sexual or Nonsexual Affiar
text:
How did I get here?

I'm ignored at home. I work every day. I come home to a companion who sits in her permanent spot on the couch with a drink in one hand and her phone in the other. Dinner is in the microwave and there may or not be a beer in the fridge. I eat while she Facebooks and pretends to watch the televison. I reach for the remote only to be denied then I return to my meal as I get a full detailed description of everything that is wrong with her friend's eyebrows in her most recent Instagram picture.

This is my Monday, my Tuesday, my Wednesday, my Thursday...you get the point.

I have a life. And interesting one. I read a lot and the things I read dance in my head and give birth to so many other thoughts and it would be so nice to hear just once, "what's in your mind?"

Do I want intimacy? Of course. Who doesn't like to be pet, kissed, rubbed, hugged, undressed and caressed? 

But let's be honest here. There's only so much s*cking and f*cking that can occur. Even under the influence of C's, V's and/or some good Peruvian, there can be only so much sexy action happening. At some point ,we will have to talk. We will have to discuss something. Even if it's the next roll in the hay.

Conversation. I miss it. I miss the long talks about nothing. The excitement I felt when my notification light blinks and it's a long message about whatever that makes me smile or laugh or better yet, think. I love a good thought provoking email.

I can't bring myself to pay for an adult dating site. I for one don't know if it's worth the investment and I can't help but think after my money is spent, I'll end up talking to an intern assigned to my account that send me nudes stolen for a website in Poland.

So I am here. CL. The last stop the needy and cheap. The place where one is more likely to start a relationship with a Nigerian scam artist rather than a real woman. But I have hope.

I have hope that some internally beautiful woman is still reading and is waiting for me to finish so she can respond and engage me. I have hope that I will see my notification light blink and it's the first of many emails; that leads to a secret meeting that leads to a secret (blank)-ship.

Here's to hope!

title: Joyce, I Miss You
text:
Joyce, it's been just over two years that you've been gone. I can honestly say that I miss you
every day. There are those that feel that the craigslist personals is a hellhole, and I guess I
probably agree, but I met you through CL and it was one of the best things that could have
happened to me. 

I posted an ad seeking a mature woman and through a crazy circumstance you responded. 
For some reason we hit it off immediately. Your mind was open enough to understand my
situation and you shared a bit of your unfortunate situation. We'd been writing for two
weeks when you surprised me by asking when we might meet. We agreed on a time and place
and I was nervous, wondering if I could go through with it. I did, and couldn't have been happier. I
think we probably intended to spend an hour or two making polite conversation. It turned into
six hours and we delved deeply into our lives. I think we were both surprised by the information
we shared but felt relieved that we had each other to talk to. I know we could have stayed and
talked longer but we both needed to get home. I walked you to your car, we shared a few more 
words, then I asked if I may kiss you. It was nice and we kissed again, then we parted. As I
drove away I wanted to go back and see if you were still there. You later told me you sat in
the parking lot a while longer hoping I'd return.

We built a relationship based on friendship. Yes, we were lightly intimate but agreed not to take
things too far. You know...not go all the way, and we were fine with that. Being together seemed
to suit us just fine. Talking, doing small things together, writing at night. All told, we had about
nine months together, then life got in the way. We kept in touch by e-mail and the occasional
phone call. About a week or so after our last call it dawned on me that you hadn't written. For
the fun of it, I googled you name. What I saw felt like a hard punch to the stomach. I saw your
obituary. I think I wanted to cry but couldn't. I'd been taken by surprise. I knew you weren't
entirely healthy but certainly never expected your sudden passing.

Sometimes I'll go for a walk alone and it seems like the sun is shining directly on me. I like to
think that's you smiling at me. I'll step outside in the dark on occasion looking to the southwest
at a particularly bright star. I feel it's you once again and I have to tell you how I feel. 

I never said "I love you". Because we were both married I didn't feel it would be fair to you,
though we sort of joked about it. Now I say it each night. I love you and miss you terribly.

I'm a 41-year-old nutritionist and nutrition writer living in Ravenswood. I'm self-employed and work most of my days alone, so I find meeting quality folks for coffee or dinner sometimes challenging. 

Right now I'm aspiring to become more thoughtful, kind, vulnerable, and authentic (knowing Brene Brown's books help here.) Really, a spiritual journey (I do Transcendental Meditation and yoga regularly) to become a better, kinder, more thoughtful person.

My favorite things are pretty simple: Museums, movies (tend towards art/ foreign), plays/ musicals, reading, writing, meditation, wandering new neighborhoods, long walks, and good meals (but definitely not a foodie). Looking forward to the nicer weather to wander neighborhoods. 

I'm low-key, quiet at first but fairly easy to get to know, prefer small groups but mostly one-on-one rather than massive gatherings.

I'm a gay male, but that doesn't really matter. Straight, female, or otherwise who can strike up an intelligent conversation becomes a wonderful start. Please be in your 30s, 40s, or 50s. I just find more in common with that age range.

Let's start with a few emails and see whether we click. Please describe yourself. Ideally something developing into platonic friendship would be wonderful.

Thanks for reading and I look forward to hearing from you. Jason

title: I Want More Than Platonic
text:
Before anyone jumps on me for this, I know I'm in the platonic section, but I've tried the other ones and there seems to be no real people over there so as a last resort, I'm over here. I wish there was an easy way to explain what I'm looking for, and a proper category to post in, but there isn't. I want to find a friend, a companion, a buddy to goof around with and yes...a lover. I am your basic, everyday, normal American male. I am married, (which isn't going well and why I'm here) 48 years old, and doing my best to stay in shape. I have what I consider to be a good outlook on life, all things considered. I can be serious when the situation calls for it, but a crazy knucklehead as well. I love making people laugh and enjoy being spontaneous.

title: Long Distance Pen Pal
text:
I'll try my best to describe what I'd like, but I think the right person will understand. First of all, I"m not looking to meet. Where I am is not particularly relevant, but let's just say it's way too far for a meeting, even if I was interested. Basically, I'm looking for conversations that are outside our daily lives, the stuff you wouldn't normally voice out loud. This encompasses so many things, which I'm not going to list, but let's just say I speak my mind, No topic is off limits or "too soon" if it's funny. 

For the most part, I miss laughing. I had an on-line friend for about two years, and we used to have a lot of these weird conversations- and about our daily lives too- but I mostly miss those random, uninhibited thoughts that showed me who he really was. That's my take on it anyway- most of what we show the world on a daily basis is the version of "us" that is socially acceptable. I'd like to find someone who accepts me even if it doesn't always sound safe or sane. I'd like to do the same for you.

If you think this is for you, please feel free to introduce yourself, and include the same stats I've listed about myself in this ad. Oh, two things: 1) Please be a decent writer, who will write more than two sentences of "text speak". I will not respond to one- two line emails, or retarded questions like "Are you real?"; 2) Please have time to write more than once in a blue moon. I think once a day is reasonable, given all the responsibilities we have at home and work. It could be more on some days, but if you expect frequent emails every day, I'm not the one.

Finally, please don't be offended if I don't respond. It's not personal, it's Craigslist. In any case, thank you for taking the time to read my ad.

title: Nerds, Artists, Gamers, Cooks and Intelligent People!
text:
Hello!

So I am looking to find some really amazing people to hang out with more frequently outside of my current circle of friends. I am fine with both girls and guys (as long as you are not looking for something sexual or otherwise - I have been in a happy relationship for 6 years and am not looking!). I work from home as a freelance concept artist/ illustrator, so I have a more flexible schedule where I can be free afternoons, evenings and weekends when I want. I'd love to find someone who would like to just hang out at the apartment keeping each other company, playing games, watching Netflix etc. Also, my boyfriend and I host board game nights sometimes, and we'd love to find people who might be interested in that as well! (If you are allergic to cats, I have two of them... just a note)

Some things that we would ideally have in common:

Love of video games
Ditto for board games
Interest in digital art and animation (I graduated in animation and I love cartoons and animated movies!)
Reading books - they are so awesome and we should all read more
Cooking - I really enjoy cooking at home, and trying out new recipes and I'd love if I had a competent partner to help me cook sometimes together
Photography - I just got a new camera and I'd love to go out and learn it's workings with a friend
Being friendly, enjoying a great conversation about nothing or everything, visiting some new restaurants without breaking the bank, and just being an interesting person. 

Please don't smoke, I am seriously allergic. Also, if you are in the suburbs, I don't have a car and really dislike traveling 2 hours on the train, so you would have to be willing to visit me in the city. If you are friendly, kind of nerdy, or just like what you hear, feel free to message me. The response has to be more than two sentences and coherent (it's hard to get a read on someone who writes " yo, i b same." ) Put Ratatouille in the subject line, so I know you aren't a robot. 

I look forward to hearing from you!

title: Who else likes cuddling?
text:
Though I am not a stranger to strictly platonic cuddling, I think my life would feel more complete if I had another friend who enjoyed cuddling.

While cuddling I can offer deep conversation; I enjoy respectful exchanges about love, philosophy, and religion/spirituality. If silence is preferable, I can agree to that as well; certainly there are times when the presence of another is enough to feel satisfied. And if you are not up for conversation or silence, I have a number of DVDs we could watch, and I enjoy a wide range of musical genres. If you like being gushed over, I could help you with that.

When it comes to friendship, I tend to prefer the company of women, which is why I am here. I also happen to be a lesbian and a trans woman. It makes no difference to me what your orientation is because, again, this is about friendship. I also do not discriminate on the basis of race or ethnicity.

I recently started seeing someone. She and I have talked about my love of cuddling, and she has unambiguously told me that she will not mind if I cuddle with other people.

If this is to happen, I would want our first meetup to be in a public place where we would have the option of experiencing a minimal amount of physical contact, such as hand-holding, without getting glared at. I think a cafe works well for this, but I am open to other suggestions. I can host subsequent get-togethers.

What do you think?

title: Message In A Bottle
text:
Depending on your age, you might have the sultry tones of Sting's voice bouncing in your head. And that's aces! Also, sorry for the ear-worm.

Bug I've digressed from my own narrative before even starting. Tsk, tsk self. Here goes...

You find a bottle on the beach. (I suppose it's bad form for me to emote on your behalf, but it's just for the prologue, I promise this is the last time, but for sake of getting to the point...) You reach down and pick it up, noticing a small brown parchment inside. You fish it out, unfurl and smooth it out on the edge of a park-bench. Scrawled on the missive, in naive but passable calligraphy are the words:

"I'm trapped in a world of bankers, accountants, engineers, and haters of the Oxford comma. If you've found this, and you can endure geekery..."

Enjoy walking around the city and check out different neighbourhoods , also fun just looking at the buildings, some amazing ones out there. I do enjoy checking out new photographers and once inawhile try my hand at pics, I usually like to take pics of buildings but im a novice if anything.

In the case of music I think my collection is eclectic. I can only pin down one style that is my fav but there are so many sub-genres of it, I love punk so you can see that style leads off into to so many other genres lol.

Flim is another area that I hope to meet guys who like the odd indie film or even the really dumb films like 'They Live' or 'Army of Darkness' , I do enjoy most genres. I do love the classics , film noir is to die for , check out 'the Third Man' , the 'The Killers' , Odd Man Out amazin stuff. Have been watching a lot of classics of late , James Gagney is the king of cool gangster. Foreign films can be cool too , one of my fav french ones is Le Grand Illusions.

Oh I really like old time radio , some are my favs are X-minus One , The Third Man , The Whistler , and anything with Orson Wells. Some of those shows take you further than any film out there , hell it is true about the theater of the mind is much more fantastic

title: Gal Pal Needed
text:
Okay, I admit it. I'm in need of a gal pal. I haven't used Craigslist in years, but I've had a few glasses of wine and I'm bingeing Friends on Netflix and missing having my own gal pals (that don't have kids or spend all their spare time with their husbands - no judgement!)

A little about me, I'm 35, a freelance writer, and in a serious relationship (pervs need not apply). I'm addicted to podcasts, BRAVO, my cat, and politics (liberal as a loon).

I'm just looking for a gal to bond with (preferably in the city), have dinner, drink wine with, and confide and gossip with!

If you're interested in drinking wine, talking, or just going for a walk by the lake - please respond. I have friends of all ages (some have moved, some have kids, some are just too busy), so I'm not worried about age or looks, just as long as you're fun!

title: Professional Black Friends
text:
Let me start by saying that I don't live in your city. I live hours away and I've had difficulty identifying like-minded black professional friends. 

I have a great career but my social life is lacking. I'm incredibly down-to-earth, relaxed, honest, etc.

I am in my late 20s and somehow I've made my career my life. I'm single and I don't have any children.

I enjoy traveling, shopping, relaxing at home, some reality TV, etc (I enjoy the simple things). Family and friends are incredibly important to me and above all else I am a Christian. 

I don't club, party or engage in the use of any type of drugs. I am a social drinker. 

If you are a educated black professional (relatively close in age) I would love to hear from you. I assure you that I'm as normal and sane as they come and CL is a unusual approach for me. 

Thanks for reading. . .

title: Who else likes cuddling?
text:
Though I am not a stranger to strictly platonic cuddling, I think my life would feel more complete if I had another friend who enjoyed cuddling.

While cuddling I can offer deep conversation; I enjoy respectful exchanges about love, philosophy, and religion/spirituality. If silence is preferable, I can agree to that as well; certainly there are times when the presence of another is enough to feel satisfied. And if you are not up for conversation or silence, I have a number of DVDs we could watch, and I enjoy a wide range of musical genres. If you like being gushed over, I could help you with that.

When it comes to friendship, I tend to prefer the company of women, which is why I am here. I also happen to be a lesbian and a trans woman. It makes no difference to me what your orientation is because, again, this is about friendship. I also do not discriminate on the basis of race or ethnicity.

I recently started seeing someone. She and I have talked about my love of cuddling, and she has unambiguously told me that she will not mind if I cuddle with other people.

If this is to happen, I would want our first meetup to be in a public place where we would have the option of experiencing a minimal amount of physical contact, such as hand-holding, without getting glared at. I think a cafe works well for this, but I am open to other suggestions. I can host subsequent get-togethers.

What do you think?

title: Chat
text: Imagine you are married. Not just for 1 or 2 years, but for quite a long time. Imagine being in the same space with that person, but no longer having anything in common with them. Wishing you had someone to talk with, confide in, laugh and joke with. Not going from day to day without the closeness you once enjoyed. A woman and a man, a man and a woman. I'd like to have that once again. Yes, I am older, but think younger. I'm looking for a female friend, not hung up on age. Who would enjoy corresponding with a fun, caring, educated guy. I'm not trying to get laid here. I just want someone to talk with, to share ideas, and perhaps a laugh. If you find what I am saying here compelling in some way, contact me. You won't be sorry.

title: Message In A Bottle
text:
Depending on your age, you might have the sultry tones of Sting's voice bouncing in your head. And that's aces! Also, sorry for the ear-worm.

Bug I've digressed from my own narrative before even starting. Tsk, tsk self. Here goes...

You find a bottle on the beach. (I suppose it's bad form for me to emote on your behalf, but it's just for the prologue, I promise this is the last time, but for sake of getting to the point...) You reach down and pick it up, noticing a small brown parchment inside. You fish it out, unfurl and smooth it out on the edge of a park-bench. Scrawled on the missive, in naive but passable calligraphy are the words:

"I'm trapped in a world of bankers, accountants, engineers, and haters of the Oxford comma. If you've found this, and you can endure geekery..."
